original: @78b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @78b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: laksha aa bhi dha n'a ta auddhri to la ghu tantra pinda aartha bi wa ra nam n'a ma /
analyzed: laksha aa bhi dha n'a ta auddhri to la ghu tantra pinda aartha bi wa ra nam n'a ma /
translated: Lakṣābhidhānāṭṭkā uddhṛtā laghutantrapiṇḍārthavivaraṇanāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa las phyung ba nyung du'i rgyud kyi bsdus pa'i don rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa las phyung ba nyung du'i rgyud kyi bsdus pa'i don rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Explanation of the Condensed Meaning of the Concise Tantra Extracted from the Hundred Thousand Expressions of the Glorious Heruka

original: dpal he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Heruka!

original: gang gi g-yon dang g-yas pa'i zhabs kyis gzhu 'dzin dang ni gangs ri'i bu mo nyi mar brdzis //
analyzed: gang gi g-yon dang g-yas pa'i zhabs kyis gzhu 'dzin dang ni gangs ri'i bu mo nyi mar brdzis //
translated: With your left and right feet, you trample the bow-bearer and the daughter of the snow mountain, the sun.

original: khro bo'i gzigs pas lha dang 'byung po lha min dbang po gza' yi tshogs bcas skrag mdzad cing //
analyzed: khro bo'i gzigs pas lha dang 'byung po lha min dbang po gza' yi tshogs bcas skrag mdzad cing //
translated: With your wrathful gaze, you terrify the gods, spirits, demigod lords, and hosts of planets.

original: phyag rgya glang po stag lpags brang 'gro dge byed mi yi thod pa mgo bo'i phreng bas brgyan //
analyzed: phyag rgya glang po stag lpags brang 'gro dge byed mi yi thod pa mgo bo'i phreng bas brgyan //
translated: You are adorned with the mudras of elephant, tiger skin, and human skull garland.

original: de la btud nas de yi rgyud dang 'grel bshad gsal ba rdo rje'i tshig rnams 'byed pa 'di bri bya //
analyzed: de la btud nas de yi rgyud dang 'grel bshad gsal ba rdo rje'i tshig rnams 'byed pa 'di bri bya //
translated: Bowing to you, I write this commentary on your tantra, clarifying the vajra words.

original: dpa' bo'i dbang pos bskul ba 'di //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i dbang pos bskul ba 'di //
translated: This is the urging of the Lord of Heroes.

original: dpal phyag rdo rje bdag gis ni //
analyzed: dpal phyag rdo rje bdag gis ni //
translated: I, Śrī Vajrapāṇi,

original: rnal 'byor pa yi dge spel zhing //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yi dge spel zhing //
translated: in order to increase the virtue of the yogī

original: phyag rgya che 'bras thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: phyag rgya che 'bras thob bya'i phyir //
translated: and to attain the result of mahāmudrā,

original: de nas mngon brjod 'bum pa yi //
analyzed: de nas mngon brjod 'bum pa yi //
translated: then from the Tantra of the Hundred Thousand Verses of the Lakṣābhidhāna,

original: rgyud las snying po phyung ba ni //
analyzed: rgyud las snying po phyung ba ni //
translated: the essence was extracted

original: dpal he ru ka rnal 'byor che //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka rnal 'byor che //
translated: and the great yoga of Śrī Heruka

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
translated: was bound in the web of the ḍākinīs.

original: snyigs ma lnga yi dus 'dir ni //
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga yi dus 'dir ni //
translated: In this time of the five degenerations,

original: bsod nams ye shes 'bras thob phyir //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes 'bras thob phyir //
translated: in order to attain the result of merit and wisdom,

original: phag mos gsol btab rdo rje can //
analyzed: phag mos gsol btab rdo rje can //
translated: the vajra holder, requested by Vārāhī,

original: nyung du'i rgyud ni rab gsal mdzad //
analyzed: nyung du'i rgyud ni rab gsal mdzad //
translated: made the Tantra of the Small Text very clear.🔽For the benefit of practitioners

original: tshe thung brtson 'grus chung ba yi //🔽sgrub po rnams la phan phyir te //
analyzed: tshe thung brtson 'grus chung ba yi // sgrub po rnams la phan phyir te //
translated: who have little diligence and short lives,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang sogs ldan la //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang sogs ldan la //
translated: even those who possess desire, anger, and so on,

original: de nyid kyi ni thabs kyis kyang //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ni thabs kyis kyang //
translated: by means of that very method,

original: gsang chen mkha' 'gro ma gsang ba //
analyzed: gsang chen mkha' 'gro ma gsang ba //
translated: the secret of the great secret ḍākinī,

original: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
translated: always abiding as all-pervading,

original: sems dpa' pho nya kun rang bzhin //
analyzed: sems dpa' pho nya kun rang bzhin //
translated: the messenger of the sattva, by nature,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba che //
translated: is Vajrasattva, great bliss.

original: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
translated: This is the self-originated Bhagavān.

original: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa //
translated: Accomplisher of all desired aims,

original: sgra yi tshul las rnam par 'das //
analyzed: sgra yi tshul las rnam par 'das //
translated: Beyond the way of sound,

original: dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul te //
analyzed: dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul te //
translated: The domain of conduct of the commitments,

original: thog ma dbus mthar yang dag gnas //
analyzed: thog ma dbus mthar yang dag gnas //
translated: Correctly abiding in the beginning, middle, and end,

original: 'jig rten gsum du rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du rnyed par dka' //
translated: Difficult to attain in the three worlds,

original: thabs dang shes rab las byung ba //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab las byung ba //
translated: Arisen from method and wisdom,

original: sngags dang rnal 'byor cho ga'i rim //🔽brjod byar bshad pa de nyid ni //
analyzed: sngags dang rnal 'byor cho ga'i rim // brjod byar bshad pa de nyid ni //
translated: The stages of mantra and yoga rituals,🔽That reality explained as the expressed

original: rjod par byed par gsungs pa ste //
analyzed: rjod par byed par gsungs pa ste //
translated: Is said to be the expresser.🔽The heruka of the joy of coemergence,

original: lhan cig skyes dga' he ru ka / dbu ma mchog gis dbugs 'byung ba //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes dga' he ru ka / dbu ma mchog gis dbugs 'byung ba //
translated: The supreme central channel, exhalation,

original: bshad gci zla ba nyi ma yi //
analyzed: bshad gci zla ba nyi ma yi //
translated: The channels of feces and urine, the moon and sun,

original: rtsa ni bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: rtsa ni bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
translated: Endowed with the four

original: phyag rgya chen po rten med pa //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po rten med pa //
translated: The great seal, without support,

original: rdo rje phag mo rigs ldan ma //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo rigs ldan ma //
translated: The family member Vajravārāhī,

original: las kyi phyag rgya'i bde @79a * //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'i bde @79a * //
translated: The bliss of the action seal,

original: spangs pa'i // rnal 'byor pa des de mchod bya //
analyzed: spangs pa'i // rnal 'byor pa des de mchod bya //
translated: That yogin should worship that.

original: zhes pa ae wam dbang bskur don //
analyzed: zhes pa ae wam dbang bskur don //
translated: That is the meaning of the empowerment of evam,

original: nyung du'i rgyud las gsal min gang //
analyzed: nyung du'i rgyud las gsal min gang //
translated: Which is not clear in the short tantras.

original: mdor bsdus tsam zhig rab gsungs te //
analyzed: mdor bsdus tsam zhig rab gsungs te //
translated: A mere summary is well explained here.

original: 'grel pas rnam par rgyas par bya //
analyzed: 'grel pas rnam par rgyas par bya //
translated: The commentary will elaborate on this.

original: 'dir dang por re zhig brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa dang 'brel pa dang dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa rnams mngon par gzigs nas /
analyzed: 'dir dang por re zhig brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa dang 'brel pa dang dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa rnams mngon par gzigs nas /
translated: Here, first of all, having perceived the subject matter, the speaker, the connection, the purpose, and the purpose of the purpose,

original: gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams kyis rang gi sems kyis bsam pas skye ba 'dir sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa /
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams kyis rang gi sems kyis bsam pas skye ba 'dir sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa /
translated: the Blessed One, who bestows buddhahood in this very life by the power of one's own mind to the people to be trained who are free from doubt,

original: gsang chen mchog la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: gsang chen mchog la bzhugs pa /
translated: who abides in the supreme great secret,

original: dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: who is surrounded by the lords of heroes and heroines,

original: rdo rje phag mos gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mos gsol ba btab pa /
translated: who is requested by Vajravarahi,

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru kas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru kas /
translated: the Blessed Glorious Heruka,

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa las snying po las snying po mchog gi rgyud gzhung gi tshad stong bdun brgya pa yang dag par bstan to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa las snying po las snying po mchog gi rgyud gzhung gi tshad stong bdun brgya pa yang dag par bstan to zhes pa'o //
translated: has perfectly taught the Tantra of the Supreme Essence, the essence of the Tantra of One Hundred Thousand Verses, with a text length of seventeen hundred verses.

original: 'dir shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the Blessed One Śrī Heruka, who is the embodiment of wisdom and means, is the subject matter.

original: 'dir rtogs par byed pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rtogs par byed pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Here, the king of explanatory tantras is the means of expression.

original: rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba de dag gis phan tshun brjod bya rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba de dag gis phan tshun brjod bya rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: The mutual relationship between those means of expression and subject matter is the defining characteristic of the expressed and the expresser.

original: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa sems can gyi don byed pa dang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa sems can gyi don byed pa dang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The performance of the welfare of sentient beings, such as entering the maṇḍala, and the attainment of mundane powers is the purpose.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa dang sangs rgyas nyid ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa dang sangs rgyas nyid ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the mahāmudrā power through the accumulation of merit and gnosis and the attainment of buddhahood is the ultimate purpose.

original: 'di rnams mngon par gzigs nas ;
analyzed: 'di rnams mngon par gzigs nas ;
translated: Having seen these,

original: gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams kyis zhes pa nges pa ni nyan thos kyi sdom pa ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo nges pa dang bral ba rnams kyis zhes pa nges pa ni nyan thos kyi sdom pa ste /
translated: those beings to be tamed who are free from certainty are those who lack the certainty of the śrāvaka vow.

original: de dang bral ba ni nges pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni nges pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from that is free from certainty.

original: de rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa ni 'dod chags dang zhes dang la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bsam pa ni 'dod chags dang zhes dang la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: Their own minds are of the nature of desire, anger, and so forth.

original: rang gi sems kyi bsam pa des kyang /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi bsam pa des kyang /
translated: By means of that,🔽they bestow buddhahood in this life.

original: skye ba 'dir sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa ni snyigs ma lnga'i dus na tshe thung zhing brtson 'grus chung ba'i sgrub pa po rnams kyang skye ba 'dir sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa ni bsgom pa'i thabs de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: skye ba 'dir sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa ni snyigs ma lnga'i dus na tshe thung zhing brtson 'grus chung ba'i sgrub pa po rnams kyang skye ba 'dir sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa ni bsgom pa'i thabs de nyid kyis so //
translated: Even practitioners of short life and little diligence in the age of five degenerations are bestowed buddhahood in this life by means of that method of meditation.

original: gsang chen mchog la bzhugs pa zhes ba chos 'byung @79b nam mkha'i khams ni gsang chen te /
analyzed: gsang chen mchog la bzhugs pa zhes ba chos 'byung @79b nam mkha'i khams ni gsang chen te /
translated: Abiding in the supreme secret means abiding in the secret, the space element, the source of phenomena.

original: de la bzhugs pa ni gsang chen mchog la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzhugs pa ni gsang chen mchog la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Abiding in that is abiding in the supreme secret.

original: dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba zhes pa dpa' bo ni thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba zhes pa dpa' bo ni thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: Surrounded by the lords of heroes and heroines means the heroes are Skull-Garland and the others, the twenty-four.

original: zla ba'i rkang pa rnams so //
analyzed: zla ba'i rkang pa rnams so //
translated: They are the feet of the moon.

original: dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma ni mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma ni mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: The heroines are the dakinis and so forth.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: They are the nature of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: de rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: Surrounded by them means surrounded by the heroes and heroines.

original: rdo rje phag mos gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mos gsol ba btab pa /
translated: Vajravarahi made a request:

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka zhes pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka zhes pa /
translated: The Bhagavan is called Shri Heruka.

original: shr'i yig gnyis med ye shes te //
analyzed: shr'i yig gnyis med ye shes te //
translated: The two SHRAIM syllables are nondual wisdom.

original: he yig rgyu dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: he yig rgyu dang bral ba'o //
translated: The HE syllable is free from cause.

original: ru yig gzugs las nges par grol //
analyzed: ru yig gzugs las nges par grol //
translated: The RU syllable is definitely liberated from form.

original: ka yig byed pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ka yig byed pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The KA syllable is free from action.🔽And:

original: zhes pa dang / dbang phyug la sogs yon tan ldan //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / dbang phyug la sogs yon tan ldan //
translated: Endowed with the qualities of Shiva and so forth,

original: bha ga yang ni bdud bcom phyir //
analyzed: bha ga yang ni bdud bcom phyir //
translated: and because the bhaga is also the conqueror of Mara,

original: gang la de mnga'i phyir na ni //
analyzed: gang la de mnga'i phyir na ni //
translated: he who possesses that is

original: bcom ldan khams gsum dbang phyug gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan khams gsum dbang phyug gsungs //
translated: called the Bhagavan, the lord of the three realms.

original: zhes pa'o // bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka des rtsa ba'i rgyud mngon par brjod pa 'bum ba las snying po las snying po mchog gi rgyud gzhung gi tshad stong bdun brgya pa yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka des rtsa ba'i rgyud mngon par brjod pa 'bum ba las snying po las snying po mchog gi rgyud gzhung gi tshad stong bdun brgya pa yang dag par bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One, the glorious Heruka, taught this tantra, the essence of the essence, the supreme tantra, which is 1,700 verses long, from the hundred thousand root tantra, the Tantra of the Recitation of the Names of Manjushri.

original: bcom ldan 'das de yang rgyud 'di'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang rgyud 'di'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One also abides in the nature of this tantra.

original: dang po bzhugs pa'i gnas kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas dam tshig gi spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sa gnas pa dang / de nas gsol ba 'debs pa po dang / ston pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dang po bzhugs pa'i gnas kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas dam tshig gi spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sa gnas pa dang / de nas gsol ba 'debs pa po dang / ston pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: He abides in the nature of the place of the first abode, then in the nature of the place of the conduct of the commitments, then in the nature of the supplicant and the teacher,

original: rigs ldan mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas pho nya mo'i dngos grub dang / mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'dod pa'i dngos sgrub bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rigs ldan mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas pho nya mo'i dngos grub dang / mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'dod pa'i dngos sgrub bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: Then, one abides in the nature of the spiritual powers of the messenger and the worship. Then, one abides in the nature of the meditation of the desired powers. Then, one abides in the nature of the worship of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and so on, by means of the bindus of bodhicitta.

original: sdig pa thams cad las nges par grol ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas rnal 'byor pa nyid bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dam tshig bskyang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas dam tshig bral @80a * //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad las nges par grol ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas rnal 'byor pa nyid bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dam tshig bskyang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas dam tshig bral @80a * //
translated: Then, one abides in the nature of being definitely liberated from all misdeeds. Then, one abides in the nature of accomplishing the practitioner. Then, one abides in the nature of maintaining the pledges. Then, one abides in the nature of the separation from the pledges.

original: ba bsrung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / bdud rtsi lnga bza' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / tshogs kyi 'khor lo la mthe bong dang ming med dag gis zhal du zla ba'i btung ba myang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: ba bsrung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / bdud rtsi lnga bza' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / tshogs kyi 'khor lo la mthe bong dang ming med dag gis zhal du zla ba'i btung ba myang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The essence of the protection of the vase, the essence of the consumption of the five nectars, the essence of the tasting of the moon drink with the thumb and ring finger in the ganacakra maṇḍala,🔽the essence of the union of the two organs, and then the essence of the praise of the consumption of the moon.🔽The sixteen aspects of the bliss of gods and humans are the supreme unchanging bliss that should be worshipped.

original: dbang po gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas zla ba bza' bsngags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang zhes pa lha dang mi'i bde ba cha bcu drug pa 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba mchog mchod par bya'o zhes pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par gnas pa ste le'u dang po'i bsdus pa'i don🔽to / // /
analyzed: dbang po gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas zla ba bza' bsngags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang zhes pa lha dang mi'i bde ba cha bcu drug pa 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba mchog mchod par bya'o zhes pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par gnas pa ste le'u dang po'i bsdus pa'i don🔽to / // /
translated: This is the first chapter of the Bhagavān’s section, the summary.

original: de nas ri'i phug la sogs pa gnas nges pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dkyil 'khor la sogs pa de nyid bcu'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas bla ma dang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang ;
analyzed: de nas ri'i phug la sogs pa gnas nges pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dkyil 'khor la sogs pa de nyid bcu'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas bla ma dang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang ;
translated: Then, abiding in the nature of the abode, such as a mountain cave, and abiding in the nature of the ten suchnesses, such as the maṇḍala, and then abiding in the nature of worshiping the maṇḍalacakra of the guru, hero, and yoginī,

original: slob ma dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas dbang bskur ba sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / phyag rgya'i spyod pa dang / mchod ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa zhes pa bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor dang dbang bskur ba'i le'u'i ngo bor bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas dbang bskur ba sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / phyag rgya'i spyod pa dang / mchod ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa zhes pa bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor dang dbang bskur ba'i le'u'i ngo bor bzhugs pa'o //
translated: and abiding in the nature of inducting the disciple into the maṇḍala, and then abiding in the nature of bestowing the empowerment, and abiding in the nature of the conduct of the seal and worship, the Bhagavān abides in the nature of the maṇḍala and empowerment chapter.

original: de nas mkha' 'gro ma'i gnas su rol pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas sngags btu ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas rig pa'i rgyal po'i las rab 'byam gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub brgyad bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de nas mkha' 'gro ma'i gnas su rol pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas sngags btu ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas rig pa'i rgyal po'i las rab 'byam gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub brgyad bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: Then, one should abide in the nature of the play of the ḍākinīs, then in the nature of the extraction of the mantra, then in the nature of the extensive activities of the king of knowledge mantras, then in the nature of the accomplishment of the eight mundane siddhis,

original: de nas brda'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / las kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas de rnams kyis yang dag par smra ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de nas brda'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / las kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas de rnams kyis yang dag par smra ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: then in the nature of the symbolic signs, then in the nature of the characteristics of the karmamudrā, then in the nature of the correct speech, going, and coming of those.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dam tshig gi ming brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dam tshig chen po brgyad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas phyag rgya dang phyag rgya'i lan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dam tshig gi ming brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dam tshig chen po brgyad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: the nature of abiding in the characteristics of the ḍākinīs, then the nature of abiding in the seal and the reply of the seal, then the nature of abiding in the utterance of the name of the pledge, and the nature of abiding in the eight great pledges, mundane and supramundane.

original: de nas gcig tu ts'a ru'i ston mo'i @80b ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / gtor ma sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas gnod mdzes rgyal po'i sngags btu ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de'i las rab 'byam bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de nas gcig tu ts'a ru'i ston mo'i @80b ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / gtor ma sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas gnod mdzes rgyal po'i sngags btu ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de'i las rab 'byam bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: Then, the nature of abiding in the single feast of caru, the nature of abiding in the offering of the bali, then the nature of abiding in the collection of the mantra of Ucchuṣma, the king, and the nature of abiding in the accomplishment of his extensive activities.

original: sngags dang gzugs brnyan dang bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i de kho na nyid bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin sreg gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: sngags dang gzugs brnyan dang bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i de kho na nyid bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin sreg gi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: Then, abiding by the nature of meditating on nonconceptual reality, abiding by the nature of the transcendent fire sacrifice,

original: de nas zhal bzhi la sogs pa'i sngags kyi rkang pa dang lhan cig dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma'i ming nang du son pa mthar thug rdo rje la sogs pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / gnas la sogs pas bcu dang gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi nges par bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de nas zhal bzhi la sogs pa'i sngags kyi rkang pa dang lhan cig dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma'i ming nang du son pa mthar thug rdo rje la sogs pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / gnas la sogs pas bcu dang gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi nges par bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: then abiding by the nature of reciting the mantra of the hero and heroine's name, which is included in the mantra of four faces, and so on, and abiding by the nature of reciting the mantra of the final vajra, and so on, and abiding by the nature of the definite explanation of the ten places, such as Potala, and the twenty-four places.

original: spyi bo la sogs par dgod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi khams rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: spyi bo la sogs par dgod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi khams rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The twenty-four heroes such as Kanakavatsa are located in the crown and so on, abiding as the nature of the thirty-seven factors conducive to awakening.🔽The goddesses are located in the sky and on the earth, abiding as the nature of the transformation of form.

original: lha mo rnams sa spyod dang mkha' la spyod pa gzugs yongs su bsgyur ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rigs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rtsa mchod pa'i 'khor lo kun du spyod pa longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: lha mo rnams sa spyod dang mkha' la spyod pa gzugs yongs su bsgyur ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / rigs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rtsa mchod pa'i 'khor lo kun du spyod pa longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The thirty-seven deities of the offering wheel are located in the conduct of the thirty-seven clans, abiding as the nature of enjoyment, dissolution, and control.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas sbrul pa dang longs spyod dang chos dang dag pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'o zhes pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'i rgyud kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas sbrul pa dang longs spyod dang chos dang dag pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'o zhes pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'i rgyud kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa'o //
translated: The essence of the Bhagavān Śrī Heruka is the abiding nature of the essence of the wheel of dharma, the abiding nature of the essence of the emanation, enjoyment, and dharma bodies, and the abiding nature of the essence of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion.

original: 'dis kyang rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid rdo rje phag mo la rab tu gsal bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'dis kyang rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid rdo rje phag mo la rab tu gsal bar mdzad pa /
translated: This also illuminates Vajravārāhī, who is the nature of the expression and the expressed.

original: de nas 'di la sa gsang ba bshad //
analyzed: de nas 'di la sa gsang ba bshad //
translated: Then, the secret stage is explained here,

original: mdor bsdus pa las rgyas par min //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa las rgyas par min //
translated: in brief, not extensively.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: And so on.

original: gal te rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad du 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas bzhugs pa'i gnas @81a * //
analyzed: gal te rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad du 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas bzhugs pa'i gnas @81a * //
translated: If the place of the abiding nature is not taught in all the kings of tantras with “thus have I heard” and so on,

original: nges par bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nges par bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: then how is it taught?

original: ji ltar rgyud 'dir de nas 'di las gsang bzhes pa la sogs pas bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bstan ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyud 'dir de nas 'di las gsang bzhes pa la sogs pas bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bstan ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung bar 'gyur /
translated: As for the question, How is it that the Bhagavān will speak in this tantra by means of 'Then, from this secret' and so on,

original: 'dus pa dang kye'i rdo rje la sogs pa rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud du /
analyzed: 'dus pa dang kye'i rdo rje la sogs pa rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud du /
translated: in the yoga and yoginī tantras such as the Guhyasamāja and Hevajra,

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rgyud bden par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rgyud bden par 'gyur ro //
translated: the statement Thus have I heard and so on are the tantra spoken by the Bhagavān.

original: de'i phyir rgyud 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bstan pa ma yin no zhes pa tshig 'bru la rab tu rton pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par bstan pa ma yin no zhes pa tshig 'bru la rab tu rton pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, some may think, “This tantra is not correctly taught by the Bhagavān.”

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will explain.

original: 'dir ma 'ongs pa'i dus na byis pa'i skye bo tshig 'bru la rab tu rton pa la brten pa rnams kyis 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes
analyzed: 'dir ma 'ongs pa'i dus na byis pa'i skye bo tshig 'bru la rab tu rton pa la brten pa rnams kyis 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes
translated: Here, in the future, childish beings who rely on the literal meaning will say, “The Tathāgata did not teach the king of tantras that is devoid of ‘Thus have I heard’ and so forth.”

original: gang zhig smra bar 'gyur ba de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig smra bar 'gyur ba de ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan du rton pa bzhis gsungs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan du rton pa bzhis gsungs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Bhagavān taught elsewhere the four reliances.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: don la rton par bya'i tshig 'bru la rton pa ma yin pa dang / ye shes la rton par bya'i rnam par shes pa la rton pa ma yin pa dang / nges pa'i don la rton par bya'i drang ba'i don la rton pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: don la rton par bya'i tshig 'bru la rton pa ma yin pa dang / ye shes la rton par bya'i rnam par shes pa la rton pa ma yin pa dang / nges pa'i don la rton par bya'i drang ba'i don la rton pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: Rely on the meaning, not the words; rely on the wisdom, not on consciousness; rely on the definitive meaning, not the interpretable meaning;

original: chos la rton par bya'i gang zag la rton pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos la rton par bya'i gang zag la rton pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: rely on the Dharma, not on the person.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir /
translated: Because of this statement of the Bhagavān,

original: tshig 'bru la rab tu rton pa ni theg pa gang du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig 'bru la rab tu rton pa ni theg pa gang du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gsungs so //
translated: Relying on the letter is to say, The Lord has not taught any vehicle at all.

original: dbyangs dang gsal byed tshogs ba ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal byed tshogs ba ni ming tsam ste /
translated: The collection of vowels and consonants is just a name.

original: ming can dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i chos rnams rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ming can dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i chos rnams rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The name causes one to understand things that are existent and things that are nonexistent.

original: 'dir dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i chos gcig la yang ming du mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i chos gcig la yang ming du mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, one name can be used for many things that are existent and nonexistent.

original: de rnams kyi nang nas ming gcig gtso bo'am /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang nas ming gcig gtso bo'am /
translated: Among them, one name is not the principal one,

original: gtso bo ma yin par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: nor are the others not principal.

original: thams cad kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa gcig rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa gcig rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all of them cause one to understand the existent and the nonexistent.

original: bud med dang mi mo dang na chung ma la sogs pa rnams kyis nu ma dang skrar ldan pa'i dngos po'i chos rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du nam mkha'i me tog dang nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa rnams kyis dngos @81b po med pa'i chos rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud med dang mi mo dang na chung ma la sogs pa rnams kyis nu ma dang skrar ldan pa'i dngos po'i chos rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du nam mkha'i me tog dang nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa rnams kyis dngos @81b po med pa'i chos rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, sky-flowers, sky-lotuses, and so forth, because they cause the realization of the phenomena of non-things.

original: de ltar thams cad du ming dang ming can du 'brel pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du ming dang ming can du 'brel pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, everywhere, yogis should understand the connection between the name and the named.

original: 'dir aa yig stong pa nyid rtogs par byed pa bdun pa'i mtha' can ae yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir aa yig stong pa nyid rtogs par byed pa bdun pa'i mtha' can ae yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the letter A, which causes the realization of emptiness, is at the end of the seventh [vowel], becoming the letter E.

original: de'i phyir ae zhes pa'i ming gis rnam pa thams cad kyi gzhi nam mkha'i khams gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ae zhes pa'i ming gis rnam pa thams cad kyi gzhi nam mkha'i khams gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, by the name E, the space element, which is the basis of all aspects, should be grasped.

original: de bzhin du mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, the Blessed One said in the Vajrapañjara of the Ḍākinī:

original: mkha' dbyings bems min dang ba dang // go 'byed ngab tu gsal ba dang // sna tshogs rdo rje gnas dang gzhi //
analyzed: mkha' dbyings bems min dang ba dang // go 'byed ngab tu gsal ba dang // sna tshogs rdo rje gnas dang gzhi //
translated: the abode and basis of the vajra of diversity.

original: kun gyi dbyings dang yid 'ong bar //
analyzed: kun gyi dbyings dang yid 'ong bar //
translated: The space of all, delightful,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: and so forth.🔽The supreme secret is delighted,

original: gsang chen mchog tu dgyes pa dang // thams cad bdag nyid na rtag bzhugs //
analyzed: gsang chen mchog tu dgyes pa dang // thams cad bdag nyid na rtag bzhugs //
translated: and always abides as the nature of all.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis ming sna tshogs pa'i khyad par gyis gnas bstan par gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis ming sna tshogs pa'i khyad par gyis gnas bstan par gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said that the abode is taught by the distinctions of various names.

original: de bzhin du dpal 'dus pa la sogs par /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal 'dus pa la sogs par /
translated: Similarly, in the Shri Guhyasamaja and so forth,

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: it is said, “Thus have I heard at one time,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la bzhugs so zhes pa 'di la yang ming du ma ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la bzhugs so zhes pa 'di la yang ming du ma ste /
translated: the Bhagavan abides in the bhaga of the vajra queen, the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all tathagatas.” This also has many names:🔽the e and the bhaga lotus,

original: ae dang bha ga padma dang // bde ba'i gnas su bde ba can //
analyzed: ae dang bha ga padma dang // bde ba'i gnas su bde ba can //
translated: the abode of bliss, the blissful,

original: seng ge'i khri dang dmigs pa med //
analyzed: seng ge'i khri dang dmigs pa med //
translated: the lion throne, and the absence of reference points.

original: de bzhin nyid dang pha rol phyin //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang pha rol phyin //
translated: Thusness and the perfections,

original: zhes pa rten no //
analyzed: zhes pa rten no //
translated: This is the support.

original: de bzhin du brten pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du brten pa ni //
translated: Likewise, the supported is

original: bam dang rdo rje smra mchog ster //
analyzed: bam dang rdo rje smra mchog ster //
translated: the bindu, the vajra, the giver of the supreme speech,

original: lhan cig skyes dga' 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes dga' 'gyur ba med //
translated: the innate joy, the unchanging,🔽the bliss, the peace, the virtue, the omnipresent lord, the supreme.

original: bde dang zhi ba dge ba dang // dbang phyug kun du 'gro ba mchog / ces pa la sogs pa du ma'i ming rnams kyis //
analyzed: bde dang zhi ba dge ba dang // dbang phyug kun du 'gro ba mchog / ces pa la sogs pa du ma'i ming rnams kyis //
translated: With many such names,

original: brten pa yongs su bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: brten pa yongs su bsgrags pa yin //
translated: the supported is proclaimed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod par /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod par /
translated: The Bhagavān in the Nāmasaṃgīti says:

original: ye shes sku ni rgyu med pa //
analyzed: ye shes sku ni rgyu med pa //
translated: The jñānakāya is causeless.

original: zhes pa dang / shes rab pha rol phyin pa rten /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / shes rab pha rol phyin pa rten /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the support.

original: rnam pa thams cad pa nyid brtags //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad pa nyid brtags //
translated: The investigation of all aspects

original: dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje gang //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje gang //
translated: is the compassion that is objectless.

original: de ni brten bar rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: de ni brten bar rab tu bsgrags //
translated: That is proclaimed to be the support.

original: zhes pa dang / de'i byir rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / de'i byir rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa //
translated: And in another tantra it is said:

original: ae yig cha byad bzang po gang //
analyzed: ae yig cha byad bzang po gang //
translated: The syllable e is the excellent form,

original: dbus su bam yig gis brgyan pa //
analyzed: dbus su bam yig gis brgyan pa //
translated: adorned in the middle with the syllable vaṃ.

original: bde ba thams cad kyi ni gzhi //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad kyi ni gzhi //
translated: The basis of all bliss,🔽the jewel casket of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog / ces pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog / ces pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And likewise:

original: thog mtha' med cing zhi ba ste //
analyzed: thog mtha' med cing zhi ba ste //
translated: Beginningless and endless, peaceful,

original: @82a * // dngos po dngos med zang pa'i gtso //
analyzed: @82a * // dngos po dngos med zang pa'i gtso //
translated: The chief of the empty, neither entity nor non-entity,

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
translated: Emptiness and compassion inseparable,

original: byang chub sems zhes dran pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes dran pa'o //
translated: Is remembered as the thought of awakening.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyud gzhan du mar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyud gzhan du mar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān has taught this yoga of the nature of wisdom and means in many other tantras.

original: de nas gang la 'di skad bdag gis thos pa la sogs pa yod pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rgyud yin la /
analyzed: de nas gang la 'di skad bdag gis thos pa la sogs pa yod pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rgyud yin la /
translated: Then, those who say, “That which has the words ‘Thus have I heard’ and so forth is a tantra taught by the Bhagavān,

original: gang la med pa de ni ma yin no zhes sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang la med pa de ni ma yin no zhes sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: and that which does not is not,” should not speak in that way.

original: 'dir log pa'i thos pas mngon par khengs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi sngags kyi tshul la ma mthong ba'i chos kyi skyon bzung ba las rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir log pa'i thos pas mngon par khengs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi sngags kyi tshul la ma mthong ba'i chos kyi skyon bzung ba las rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, those who are puffed up with false learning will incur a root downfall from the mantra system due to grasping at faults in the Dharma that they have not seen.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba la sogs pas thos pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa rnams mnar med par 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba la sogs pas thos pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa rnams mnar med par 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Those who are endowed with the pride of learning about the root downfalls and so forth will go to Avīci.

original: de'i phyir rgyud 'dir de nas 'di la gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i rgyud bstan pa la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud 'dir de nas 'di la gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i rgyud bstan pa la 'gal ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in teaching this tantra, beginning with “Then, the secret…” and so forth.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid shes rab dang thabs kyi chos rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid shes rab dang thabs kyi chos rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it causes the realization of the Dharma of wisdom and method, which is the nature of emptiness and compassion.

original: 'dir mngon par brjod pa 'bum par gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir mngon par brjod pa 'bum par gsungs pa /
translated: Here, it is stated in the Lakṣa-koṭi:

original: stong nyid snying rje gcig gyur pa //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje gcig gyur pa //
translated: Emptiness and compassion are one.

original: rgyud gang la ni rab bstan zhing //🔽'jig rten mgon po sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: rgyud gang la ni rab bstan zhing // 'jig rten mgon po sgrub byed pa //
translated: The tantra that teaches this

original: rgyud de sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'o //🔽'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa yis //
analyzed: rgyud de sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'o // 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa yis //
translated: is taught by the Buddha.🔽The worldly truth of the relative

original: 'jig rten dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jig rten dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: is taught for the sake of accomplishing worldly powers.

original: sngags bzlas de bzhin cho ga dang // rnam rtog sgom ba rab tu gsungs //
analyzed: sngags bzlas de bzhin cho ga dang // rnam rtog sgom ba rab tu gsungs //
translated: The recitation of mantras, the rites, and the meditation of conceptual thoughts🔽are taught for the sake of accomplishing worldly powers.

original: don dam bden pas gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: don dam bden pas gsungs pa ni //
translated: The ultimate truth is taught

original: ye shes sku ni rab bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: ye shes sku ni rab bsgrub phyir //
translated: in order to accomplish the wisdom body.🔽The Tathāgata taught the meditation

original: kun rtog thams cad spangs pa yi //🔽sgom pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs //
analyzed: kun rtog thams cad spangs pa yi // sgom pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs //
translated: that abandons all conceptual thoughts.

original: zhes pa rgyud so sor bzhag pa'i nges pa'o //🔽da ni / de nas 'di las gsang ba bshad //
analyzed: zhes pa rgyud so sor bzhag pa'i nges pa'o // da ni / de nas 'di las gsang ba bshad //
translated: This is the certainty of the individual tantras.

original: ces pa la sogs pas rgyud la gsungs pa'i drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pas rgyud la gsungs pa'i drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyis rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
translated: Now, from “Then, the secret is explained in this” and so on, the interpretable meaning and the definitive meaning of the tantra are distinguished.

original: de nas 'di las zhes pa rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bar ma chad par mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo bde mchog gi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas 'di las zhes pa rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bar ma chad par mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo bde mchog gi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: “Then, in this” means that without interruption from the Vajrabhairava samādhi, [the Bhagavān] entered into the Cakrasaṃvara ḍākinī samādhi.

original: mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa las /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa las /
translated: In the Lakṣābhidhāna,

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru kas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru kas /
translated: the Bhagavān Śrī Heruka

original: rdo rje phag mo la bos par gyur pa /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo la bos par gyur pa /
translated: calls out to Vajravārāhī:

original: kye rdo rje phag mo //🔽rnal 'byor @82b nyid dang cho ga yis //
analyzed: kye rdo rje phag mo // rnal 'byor @82b nyid dang cho ga yis //
translated: “Oh Vajravārāhī,🔽listen to the explanation of the tantra of wisdom

original: ye shes rgyud du bshad pa nyon //
analyzed: ye shes rgyud du bshad pa nyon //
translated: through the yoga and the rite.

original: zhes pa gang zhig mngon par brjod pa 'bum par he ru kar brjod pa gsang ba de nyid ngas khyod la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa gang zhig mngon par brjod pa 'bum par he ru kar brjod pa gsang ba de nyid ngas khyod la bshad par bya ste /
translated: I will explain to you that secret which is called Heruka in the Hundred Thousand, that is, in the Abhidhana Tantra.

original: mdor bsdus pa las rgyas par min //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa las rgyas par min //
translated: In brief, not in detail.

original: zhes pa'o // de ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rtsa ba'i rgyud las bsdus pa'i rgyud bstan par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rtsa ba'i rgyud las bsdus pa'i rgyud bstan par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why did the Lord teach the Condensed Tantra from the Root Tantra?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: 'dir snyigs ma lnga'i dus na 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi rnams dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i yul du tshe thung zhing shes rab dman pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir snyigs ma lnga'i dus na 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi rnams dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i yul du tshe thung zhing shes rab dman pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, in the time of the five degenerations, the people of Jambudvipa, especially those of the noble land, will have short lives and little wisdom.

original: rdo rje slob dpon gang yin pa de rnams rtsa ba'i ltung ba la 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gang yin pa de rnams rtsa ba'i ltung ba la 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are Vajra Masters will commit the root downfalls.

original: dge slong rnams mi dge ba bcu byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong rnams mi dge ba bcu byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The monks will commit the ten non-virtues.

original: khyim na gnas pa rnams dkon mchog gsum gyi rdzas nye bar longs spyod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa rnams dkon mchog gsum gyi rdzas nye bar longs spyod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The householders will enjoy the wealth of the Three Jewels.

original: mkhas pa rnams ma thos pa'i rgyud 'chad pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ma thos pa'i rgyud 'chad pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The learned will explain the tantras without having heard them.

original: mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis rgyud la dka' 'grel dang 'grel bshad byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis rgyud la dka' 'grel dang 'grel bshad byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The learned, through their pride in their higher knowledge, will compose commentaries and subcommentaries on the tantras.

original: rgyud kyi don phyin ci log tu bstan nas dmyal bar 'gro ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don phyin ci log tu bstan nas dmyal bar 'gro ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having taught the meaning of the tantras incorrectly, they will go to hell.

original: gang zhig sangs rgyas pa rmongs pa de rnams blun pa'i dad pa nyid kyis khyim na gnas pa'i slob dpon rnams la bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig sangs rgyas pa rmongs pa de rnams blun pa'i dad pa nyid kyis khyim na gnas pa'i slob dpon rnams la bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are confused about the Buddha's teachings will, through their foolish faith, honor householder masters.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa rnams la sun 'byin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa rnams la sun 'byin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who hold the victory banner of omniscience will be criticized.

original: slob ma gang yin pa de rnams bla ma dam pa'i skyon tshol ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob ma gang yin pa de rnams bla ma dam pa'i skyon tshol ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are disciples will seek out the faults of holy gurus.

original: bla ma dam pa ma yin pa bza' ba dang gnyis su med pa rnams la bstod pa dang mchod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa ma yin pa bza' ba dang gnyis su med pa rnams la bstod pa dang mchod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are not holy gurus will be praised and worshipped as if they were nondual with the deity.

original: bla ma mnyes par bya bar gsungs pa sangs rgyas kyi gsung bzhin mi byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma mnyes par bya bar gsungs pa sangs rgyas kyi gsung bzhin mi byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not act in accordance with the Buddha’s teachings, which state that one should please the guru.

original: chos ston pa po rnams mi dge ba bcu la rab tu 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos ston pa po rnams mi dge ba bcu la rab tu 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who teach the Dharma will engage in the ten nonvirtues.

original: sgrub pa po rnams phyi rol gyi bza' ba dang btung ba la longs spyod pa la chags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa po rnams phyi rol gyi bza' ba dang btung ba la longs spyod pa la chags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The practitioners will be attached to enjoying external food and drink.

original: bud med kyi 'gro ba rnams 'dod pa la shin tu brkam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med kyi 'gro ba rnams 'dod pa la shin tu brkam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Women will be extremely greedy for sex.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud thams cad las bsdus pa'i rgyud bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud thams cad las bsdus pa'i rgyud bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān taught the Condensed Tantra in all the Root Tantras.

original: de yang rdo rje'i tshig mang ba nyid kyi phyir thar pa don du gnyer ba'i @83a * //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje'i tshig mang ba nyid kyi phyir thar pa don du gnyer ba'i @83a * //
translated: Moreover, because of the many vajra words,

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis bla ma dam pa nye bar bsten pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa shad dang rgyud ni rgyud gzhan du gsungs pas shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis bla ma dam pa nye bar bsten pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa shad dang rgyud ni rgyud gzhan du gsungs pas shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: the wise who seek liberation should rely on an excellent guru and understand the explanations and commentaries composed by the bodhisattvas and the statements in other tantras.

original: de'i phyir / mdor bsdus pa las rgyas par min //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mdor bsdus pa las rgyas par min //
translated: not in detail, but in brief,

original: gsang ba bdag gis bshad par bya //🔽gsang ba zhes pa drang ba'i don gyis las kyi phyag rgya'i bha ga la brjod do //
analyzed: gsang ba bdag gis bshad par bya // gsang ba zhes pa drang ba'i don gyis las kyi phyag rgya'i bha ga la brjod do //
translated: I will explain the secret.

original: nges pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid do //🔽dpal he ru ka yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid do // dpal he ru ka yang dag sbyor //
translated: The word secret means the bhaga of the karmamudra in the interpretable meaning, and the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom in the definitive meaning.🔽The phrase the union of Sri Heruka means the innate joy.

original: zhes pa la shr'i zhes pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la shr'i zhes pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: The word sri means the innate joy.

original: he zhes pas rgyu las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya spangs pa'o //
analyzed: he zhes pas rgyu las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya spangs pa'o //
translated: The word he means the abandonment of the causal karmamudra and jnanamudra.

original: ru zhes pa gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //🔽ka zhes pa mig la sogs pa'i byed pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: ru zhes pa gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o // ka zhes pa mig la sogs pa'i byed pa spangs pa ste /
translated: The word ru means the abandonment of the characteristics of form.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The word ka means the abandonment of the functions of the eyes and so forth, which is the characteristic of non-objectifying compassion.

original: de'i yang dag sbyor zhes pa stong pa nyid dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid de stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid ngas bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yang dag sbyor zhes pa stong pa nyid dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid de stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid ngas bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The right union of that is the oneness with emptiness, and I will explain the oneness of emptiness and compassion.

original: drang ba'i don gyis dpal he ru ka ni skyes pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyis dpal he ru ka ni skyes pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The glorious Heruka of the interpretable meaning is the male organ,

original: de'i yang dag sbyor ba ni bud med kyi bha ga dang lhan cig pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i yang dag sbyor ba ni bud med kyi bha ga dang lhan cig pa nyid de /
translated: and his right union is the oneness with the bhaga of the woman,

original: byis pa'i skye bo dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don dang / sems yul gzhan las yongs su dgrol ba'i don du ngas bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don dang / sems yul gzhan las yongs su dgrol ba'i don du ngas bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: and I will explain it for the sake of the merit accumulation of the childish people who desire the bliss of the two organs, and for the sake of completely liberating the mind from other objects.

original: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa //
translated: It accomplishes all desired aims.

original: zhes pa las kyi tshig dang bdag gis bshad pa byed pa po la pa ra smee'i tshig tu thams cad rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa las kyi tshig dang bdag gis bshad pa byed pa po la pa ra smee'i tshig tu thams cad rig par bya'o //
translated: In the verbal root and verbal noun forms, all should be understood as in the present tense.

original: 'dir phyi rol du drang ba'i don gyis 'dod pa'i don kun ni phra ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yon tan brgyad kyi dbang phyug dang sngags dang las dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor gyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du drang ba'i don gyis 'dod pa'i don kun ni phra ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yon tan brgyad kyi dbang phyug dang sngags dang las dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor gyis 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the meaning of all desires, which is to be interpreted externally, is the mastery of the eight mundane qualities, such as subtlety, and so on, by the yoga of mantra, action, and gnosis seals.

original: de'i sgrub byed ni sngar brjod pa'i shes rab ye shes zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub byed ni sngar brjod pa'i shes rab ye shes zhes pa'o //
translated: The proof of that is the previously mentioned wisdom-knowledge.

original: nges pa'i don gyis 'dod pa kun gyi rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyis 'dod pa kun gyi rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: The meaning of all desires in the definitive meaning is Vajrasattva.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: It is the perfect, complete Buddha.

original: de'i don ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de //
analyzed: de'i don ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de //
translated: Its meaning is omniscience,

original: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor bar byed pa'o //
translated: which turns the wheel of Dharma, such as the ten powers, four fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: de'i sgrub byed ni 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed do //
analyzed: de'i sgrub byed ni 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed do //
translated: The proof of that is the accomplishment of all desired goals.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying @83b rje dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying @83b rje dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The yoga of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion should be explained.

original: bla ma las kyang bla ma ste //
analyzed: bla ma las kyang bla ma ste //
translated: It is the guru of the guru.

original: zhes pa bla na med pa 'dod pa'i don te mi'i yul gyi bde ba rnams kyi bla ma /
analyzed: zhes pa bla na med pa 'dod pa'i don te mi'i yul gyi bde ba rnams kyi bla ma /
translated: This is the unsurpassed goal, the best of human pleasures.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bde ba dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan brgyad dang yang dag par ldan pa'i dngos grub po //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bde ba dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan brgyad dang yang dag par ldan pa'i dngos grub po //
translated: It is the power of the eight qualities of sovereignty, etc., which is the power of the enjoyments of the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: de las kyang bla mar gyur pa ni mchog gi bla ma ste /
analyzed: de las kyang bla mar gyur pa ni mchog gi bla ma ste /
translated: And even better than that is the supreme power,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bde ba dbang phyug gi yon tan thams cad dang yang dag par ldan pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bde ba dbang phyug gi yon tan thams cad dang yang dag par ldan pa /
translated: the bliss of omniscience, endowed with all the qualities of sovereignty.

original: tshos thams cad kyi ston pa po rnam pa thams cad pa thams cad du son pa ni bla ma las kyang bla ma ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tshos thams cad kyi ston pa po rnam pa thams cad pa thams cad du son pa ni bla ma las kyang bla ma ste zhes pa'o //
translated: The teacher of all doctrines, all-aspect, all-gone, is even better than the power.

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
translated: The binding of the dakinis' network

original: zhes pa ni 'dir drang ba'i don gyis mkha' 'gro ma ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dir drang ba'i don gyis mkha' 'gro ma ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: Here, the dakinis are Vajra dakini and so forth, in the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: nang du rtsa sum cu rtsa drug po rnams dang / ye shes dang thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo rnams dang / khva la sogs pa sgo brgyad po rnams la gnas pa rnams so ;
analyzed: nang du rtsa sum cu rtsa drug po rnams dang / ye shes dang thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo rnams dang / khva la sogs pa sgo brgyad po rnams la gnas pa rnams so ;
translated: Internally, they are located in the thirty-six channels, the wheels of exalted mind, exalted wisdom, exalted speech, and exalted body, and the eight gates such as the anus.

original: / de rnams kyang bdag gi gdan la sogs pa'i ming gis gsungs pa lhag ma za ba'i dur khrod kyi mthar thug pa phyi rol du ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad po rnams su 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas gnas la sogs pa dang / spyi bo la sogs pa'i nges pa bstan pa ni brten pa'i chos rnams kyi rten du shes par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: / de rnams kyang bdag gi gdan la sogs pa'i ming gis gsungs pa lhag ma za ba'i dur khrod kyi mthar thug pa phyi rol du ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad po rnams su 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas gnas la sogs pa dang / spyi bo la sogs pa'i nges pa bstan pa ni brten pa'i chos rnams kyi rten du shes par bya'o zhes so //
translated: They are also taught by the names of my seat, and so forth, and are located externally in the eight directions of Mount Meru, in the charnel grounds that end with the charnel ground of devouring the remainder, in the sequence to be explained, and in the definitive order of the crown, and so forth.

original: mkha' 'gro ma 'di rnams kyi 'khor lo tshogs pa ni dra ba'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma 'di rnams kyi 'khor lo tshogs pa ni dra ba'o //
translated: The network of these dakinis is the assembly of wheels.

original: de'i sdom pa ni gcig nyid de /
analyzed: de'i sdom pa ni gcig nyid de /
translated: Their binding is oneness.

original: bdag gi gdan la sogs pa la he ru ka dang lhan cig 'dus pa ni //
analyzed: bdag gi gdan la sogs pa la he ru ka dang lhan cig 'dus pa ni //
translated: My seat, and so forth, is the gathering with Heruka.

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
translated: The binding of the network of dakinis.

original: zhes pa'o // he ru ka yang dpa' bo rnams dang bcas pa nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // he ru ka yang dpa' bo rnams dang bcas pa nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Heruka is the nature of twenty-five heroes,

original: rdo rje phag mo dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid can no //🔽'di rnams kyi he ru ka dang dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams dang lhan cig 'dus pa ni mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid can no // 'di rnams kyi he ru ka dang dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams dang lhan cig 'dus pa ni mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi sdom pa'o //
translated: and Vajravārāhī is the nature of thirty-seven heroines.🔽The union of these with the twenty-four Herukas and heroes is the vow of the ḍākinīs.

original: 'dir he ru ka dang lhan cig pho nya mo bcu gnyis po rnams kyi sdom pa dang / dpa' bo rnams dang lhan cig pho nya mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir he ru ka dang lhan cig pho nya mo bcu gnyis po rnams kyi sdom pa dang / dpa' bo rnams dang lhan cig pho nya mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi sdom pa'o //
translated: Here, the vow of the twelve heroines with Heruka and the vow of the twenty-four heroines with the heroes is the vow of the ḍākinīs.

original: de bzhin du a'a li k'a li'i rnal 'byor dang / sngags kyi sa bon gyis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du a'a li k'a li'i rnal 'byor dang / sngags kyi sa bon gyis brjod par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, the yoga of Alikāli and the expression of the seed syllables of the mantra should be stated.🔽Therein, the tantras of the thirty-six yoginīs🔽are the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,

original: de la re zhig rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug gi rgyud rnams /
analyzed: de la re zhig rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug gi rgyud rnams /
translated: the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tantra,

original: ka yig @84a * //
analyzed: ka yig @84a * //
translated: the Ka-tantra,🔽the Ka-tant

original: la sogs pa yi ge re res dbyangs kyi tshogs dang bcas pas gtso bo ma gtogs pa su ma cu rtsa drug gi dkyil 'khor pa'i bdag nyid dang / gtso bo dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa yi ge re res dbyangs kyi tshogs dang bcas pas gtso bo ma gtogs pa su ma cu rtsa drug gi dkyil 'khor pa'i bdag nyid dang / gtso bo dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and so on, each syllable together with the vowel diacritics, is the nature of the thirty-six deities of the mandala, excluding the principal one, and the nature of the thirty-seven deities, including the principal one.

original: de la re zhig ka rdo rje'i rgyud brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig ka rdo rje'i rgyud brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the vajra-verse of Ka will be stated.

original: snying por ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i ze'u 'bru la stong pa nyid lnga'i bdag nyid h'um yig dang / phyogs kyi 'dab ma la aa a'a aam aa: mtshams kyi 'dab ma la ka k'a kam ka: dur khrod kyi phyogs rnams su yon tan gyi dbye bas ka k'a kam ka: mtshams su ha h'a ham ha: thugs kyi 'khor lo la phyogs rnams su ki kri ku kli
analyzed: snying por ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i ze'u 'bru la stong pa nyid lnga'i bdag nyid h'um yig dang / phyogs kyi 'dab ma la aa a'a aam aa: mtshams kyi 'dab ma la ka k'a kam ka: dur khrod kyi phyogs rnams su yon tan gyi dbye bas ka k'a kam ka: mtshams su ha h'a ham ha: thugs kyi 'khor lo la phyogs rnams su ki kri ku kli
translated: On the pericarp of the wheel of wisdom in the center, there is the syllable Hum, which is the nature of the five emptinesses, and on the petals of the directions, A, A, A, A, A, and on the petals of the intermediate directions, Ka, Ka, Ka, Ka, Ka. In the directions of the charnel grounds, Ka, Ka, Ka, Ka, Ka, by the division of qualities, and in the intermediate directions, Ha, Ha, Ha, Ha, Ha. On the wheel of mind, in the directions, Ki, Ki, Ku, Klu,

original: / mtshams rnams su k'i kr'i k'u kl'i / zhes pa'o //
analyzed: / mtshams rnams su k'i kr'i k'u kl'i / zhes pa'o //
translated: and in the intermediate directions, Ki, Ki, Ku, Klu.

original: gsung gi 'khor lo la yon tan dang 'phel ba'i dbye bas phyogs rnams su ke kar ko ka la /
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo la yon tan dang 'phel ba'i dbye bas phyogs rnams su ke kar ko ka la /
translated: The wheel of enlightened speech is in the cardinal directions, with the syllables ke ka ko ka la.🔽

original: mtshams rnams su kee k'ar koo k'a la zhes pa'o //🔽sku'i 'khor lo la ya nar bsgyur ba'i dbye bas phyogs rnams su /🔽kya kra kwa kla /
analyzed: mtshams rnams su kee k'ar koo k'a la zhes pa'o // sku'i 'khor lo la ya nar bsgyur ba'i dbye bas phyogs rnams su / kya kra kwa kla /
translated: In the wheel of speech, the directions are Ka, Ke, Ko, and Ka, and the intermediate directions are Kai, Kau, and so on, by the division of qualities and increase.

original: mtshams rnams su ky'a kr'a kw'a kl'a zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams rnams su ky'a kr'a kw'a kl'a zhes pa ste /
translated: In the wheel of body, the directions are Ky, Kr, K, and Kl, and the intermediate directions are Kya, Kra, Kva, and Kla, by the division of the transformation of ya.

original: rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i chos kyis brjod pa'i gsal byed 'khor lo gsum la nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i chos kyis brjod pa'i gsal byed 'khor lo gsum la nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the consonants of the elements of wind, fire, water, and earth are twenty-four in the three wheels.

original: stong pa'i chos kyis brjod pa ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang dur khrod brgyad la bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa'i chos kyis brjod pa ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang dur khrod brgyad la bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The wheel of wisdom, which is the expression of the empty phenomena, and the eight charnel grounds are twelve.

original: des na gang zhig stong pa'i chos can gyi mkha' 'gro ma de rnams dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i sku dang lhan cig sngom pa /
analyzed: des na gang zhig stong pa'i chos can gyi mkha' 'gro ma de rnams dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i sku dang lhan cig sngom pa /
translated: Therefore, those dakinis who are the phenomena of emptiness are united with the body of nonreferential compassion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan bcu gnyis te /
translated: The twelve eyes of the Bhagavat are the twelve vowels.

original: rdo rje phag mo dang lhan cig 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo dang lhan cig 'khyud pa'o //
translated: He is embraced by Vajravārāhī.🔽The heroines are embraced by the twenty-four heroes.

original: dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams dang lhan cig 'khyud pa'o zhes pa drang ba'i don gyis mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams dang lhan cig 'khyud pa'o zhes pa drang ba'i don gyis mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom pa'o //
translated: This is the “entrapment of the web of ḍākinīs” in the interpretable meaning.

original: ka yig la ji lta ba de ltar kha rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ka yig la ji lta ba de ltar kha rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as with the letter ka, so it is with kha, ga, and so forth.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ka kha ga gha nga /
analyzed: ka kha ga gha nga /
translated: ka kha ga gha ṅa

original: tsa tsha dza dzha nya /
analyzed: tsa tsha dza dzha nya /
translated: ca cha ja jha ña

original: ta tha da dha na /
analyzed: ta tha da dha na /
translated: ta tha da dha na

original: pa pha ba bha ma /🔽ta tha da dha na /🔽sa wa sha shaka /
analyzed: pa pha ba bha ma / ta tha da dha na / sa wa sha shaka /
translated: pa pha ba bha ma

original: la wa ra ya /
analyzed: la wa ra ya /
translated: ya ra la va🔽śa ṣa sa ha kṣa

original: ha ksha: zhes pa rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi gtso mo rnams dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi gtso bo yang ste /
analyzed: ha ksha: zhes pa rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi gtso mo rnams dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi gtso bo yang ste /
translated: These are the principal yoginīs of the thirty-six mother tantras and the principal yogins of the thirty-six father tantras.

original: sa bon gcig gis rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon gcig gis rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are the maṇḍala deities complete with a single seed.

original: sa bon tha dad pa sum cu rtsa drug gis bskyed pa'i dkyil 'khor pa tha dad pa'i rgyud kyi rigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa bon tha dad pa sum cu rtsa drug gis bskyed pa'i dkyil 'khor pa tha dad pa'i rgyud kyi rigs su 'gyur te /
translated: The maṇḍala deities generated with thirty-six different seeds are of the type of the different tantras.

original: de rnams rigs gcig tu rtogs par bya @84b ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams rigs gcig tu rtogs par bya @84b ba ni ma yin no //
translated: One should not understand them as a single family.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: rigs gsum dang ni rigs lnga nyid //
analyzed: rigs gsum dang ni rigs lnga nyid //
translated: the three families and the five families

original: rang bzhin gcig dang rigs brgya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig dang rigs brgya'o //
translated: are of one nature and of a hundred families.

original: zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs las /
analyzed: zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs las /
translated: The Bhagavān has said this.🔽The yogin should understand the tantras that are of the nature of various families by relying on the meaning, which is the definitive statement of the Tathāgata.

original: rigs sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rgyud rnal 'byor bas don la rton pa la brten nas rtogs par bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o zhes pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo sdom
analyzed: rigs sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rgyud rnal 'byor bas don la rton pa la brten nas rtogs par bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o zhes pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo sdom
translated: The Cakrasaṃvara of the ḍākinīs is for the attainment of mundane powers, in the mundane relative.

original: pa'o // nges pa'i don gyis mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo sdom zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams so //
analyzed: pa'o // nges pa'i don gyis mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo sdom zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams so //
translated: The Cakrasaṃvara of the ḍākinīs in the definitive meaning is the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: de rnams kyi tshogs pa ni 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshogs pa ni 'khor lo ste /
translated: The assembly of those is the wheel,
