translated: Then, in the second year, one should recite the mantra of the eight limbs together with the names of the eight yoginis, divided into months.

original: de nas lo gsum pa la lha mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i ming dang lhan cig yan lag so so'i phreng ba'i sngags sngar brjod pa'i las rab 'byam sgrub pa'i don du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lo gsum pa la lha mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i ming dang lhan cig yan lag so so'i phreng ba'i sngags sngar brjod pa'i las rab 'byam sgrub pa'i don du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, in the third year, one should recite the mantra of the garland of individual limbs together with the names of the twenty-four goddesses for the sake of accomplishing the previously mentioned variety of activities.

original: de ltar lo gsum dang lo drug dang lo dgu dang lo bcu gnyis rnams kyis mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa drug bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar lo gsum dang lo drug dang lo dgu dang lo bcu gnyis rnams kyis mkha' 'gro ma sum cu rtsa drug bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having accomplished the thirty-six dakinis with three, six, nine, and twelve years,

original: de nas sngags pas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub las rab 'byam thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sngags pas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub las rab 'byam thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Then the mantrin should accomplish all the various activities of mundane powers. This is the rule of the Tathāgata.

original: de ltar nang du thun mtshams bzhi dang thun brgyad dang phyed dang bcas pa'i dbyu gu gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi dus sbyor gyi phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar nang du thun mtshams bzhi dang thun brgyad dang phyed dang bcas pa'i dbyu gu gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi dus sbyor gyi phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams te /
translated: Thus, in the inner [practice], there are twenty-four sectors of the zodiac, each consisting of two and a half dandas, with four periods and eight periods.

original: dus 'di rnams la nyin zhag so sor sngar brjod pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i phyir rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams mchod par bya'o zhes pa dus kyi khyad par gyis pho nya mo rnams mchod pa'i cho ga'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dus 'di rnams la nyin zhag so sor sngar brjod pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i phyir rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams mchod par bya'o zhes pa dus kyi khyad par gyis pho nya mo rnams mchod pa'i cho ga'i nges pa'o //
translated: At these times, one should worship Vajraḍāka and so forth in order to accomplish the individual siddhis mentioned above each day. This is the rule of the worship of the messengers by the distinction of time.

original: da ni rgyud gzhan dang gzhan du gsungs pa'i dus kyi khyad par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni rgyud gzhan dang gzhan du gsungs pa'i dus kyi khyad par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the distinction of time taught in other tantras and other [texts] should be mentioned.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis dus kyi khyad par rgyud dang rgyud gzhan du gsungs te //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis dus kyi khyad par rgyud dang rgyud gzhan du gsungs te //
translated: Here, the Blessed One taught the distinction of time in other tantras and other [texts].

original: 'dir ni mdor bstan pa tsam gyis gsungs so /🔽de yang rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i dgongs pas 'dir rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni mdor bstan pa tsam gyis gsungs so / de yang rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i dgongs pas 'dir rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Here, it is taught merely as an introduction.🔽Moreover, it should be understood here by the intention stated in other tantras.

original: rgyud ni rgyud gzhan gyis rtogs par bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsungs las so //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyud gzhan gyis rtogs par bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsungs las so //
translated: The tantra should be understood by another tantra.

original: de ltar dus kyi khyad par don dang por re zhig rdo rje gdan bzhir chu srin la sogs pa'i dus sbyor gang @91a * //
analyzed: de ltar dus kyi khyad par don dang por re zhig rdo rje gdan bzhir chu srin la sogs pa'i dus sbyor gang @91a * //
translated: Thus, the special time is the first topic. First, the twelve signs beginning with Aries, which are the zodiacs of the crocodile and so on,

original: yin pa de rnams ro hi ta la sogs pa rtsa bcu gnyis dang / rgyal la sogs bzla ba bcu gnyis gang yin pa de rnams ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: yin pa de rnams ro hi ta la sogs pa rtsa bcu gnyis dang / rgyal la sogs bzla ba bcu gnyis gang yin pa de rnams ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis rnams so //
translated: are the twelve months beginning with Rohiṇī, which are the twelve links beginning with ignorance.

original: de ltar phyi rol dang nang du lo so so dang / nyin zhag so so la dus sbyor bcu gnyis rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol dang nang du lo so so dang / nyin zhag so so la dus sbyor bcu gnyis rnams te /
translated: Thus, there are twelve two-hour periods externally and internally in each day and in each month.

original: dus sbyor re re ni dbyu gu lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dus sbyor re re ni dbyu gu lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Each two-hour period has the nature of five nāḍīs.

original: dbyu gu ni chu srang drug cu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dbyu gu ni chu srang drug cu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: A nāḍī has the nature of sixty palas.

original: chu srang ni dbugs drug gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: chu srang ni dbugs drug gi bdag nyid do //
translated: A ghatikā is of the nature of six breaths.

original: de ltar nyin mtshan gyi dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar nyin mtshan gyi dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rnams 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, there are twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths in a day and night.

original: phyi rol du nyi ma'i dbyu gu dang nang du ni dbugs rnams so //
analyzed: phyi rol du nyi ma'i dbyu gu dang nang du ni dbugs rnams so //
translated: The ghatikās are external, and the breaths are internal.

original: de ltar nyin mtshan gyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyin mtshan gyis zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is said to be by day and night.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal kye'i rdo rjer gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal kye'i rdo rjer gsungs te /
translated: In the same way, the Bhagavān said in the Śrī Hevajra Tantra:

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo la rkang pa dang bcas pa'i chu srang lnga bcu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid kyi dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi dang bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo dbyu gu gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / longs spyod kyi 'khor lo la chu tshod gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi 'pho ba bcu drug dang /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo la rkang pa dang bcas pa'i chu srang lnga bcu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid kyi dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi dang bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo dbyu gu gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / longs spyod kyi 'khor lo la chu tshod gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi 'pho ba bcu drug dang /
translated: In the emanation cakra, there are sixty-four ghatikās, which are of the nature of fifty-six ghatikās and legs. In the great-bliss cakra, there are thirty-two ghatikās, which are of the nature of two ghatikās. In the enjoyment cakra, there are sixteen transits, which are of the nature of two ghatikās.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo la thun mtshams brgyad de /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo la thun mtshams brgyad de /
translated: In the dharmacakra, there are eight periods.

original: 'dir longs spyod dang bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo go bzlog pa ni bla ma'i nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir longs spyod dang bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo go bzlog pa ni bla ma'i nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the reversal of the wheel of enjoyment and great bliss is taught by the guru.

original: de ltar nyin mtshan gyi dus kyi khyad par nyung du'i rgyud las mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyin mtshan gyi dus kyi khyad par nyung du'i rgyud las mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus, the distinctions of day and night are summarized from the Tantra of Few Words.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud du ni bcom ldan 'das kyis slar yang mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud du ni bcom ldan 'das kyis slar yang mngon par brjod pa 'bum pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa /
translated: In the Root Tantra, the Bhagavān again taught extensively in the Hundred Thousand Verses on Exoteric Dharma and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: de la phyi rol du nyi ma'i lo so so ni nyin zhag nyid do //
analyzed: de la phyi rol du nyi ma'i lo so so ni nyin zhag nyid do //
translated: Externally, each year is a day.

original: nyin zhag de la dus kyi khyad par dbyu gu drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rnams te de rnams kyang nyi ma'i dbugs so //
analyzed: nyin zhag de la dus kyi khyad par dbyu gu drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rnams te de rnams kyang nyi ma'i dbugs so //
translated: On that day, the distinctions of time are the twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths of the sun.

original: de rnams kyang nang du nyin zhag so sor lus can rnams kyis dbugs so zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang nang du nyin zhag so sor lus can rnams kyis dbugs so zhes so //
translated: Those are the internal breaths of embodied beings on each day.

original: de ltar phyi rol du lo la dbyu gu drug cu drug cu'i bdag nyid kyi nyin zhag drug cu lhag pa'i sum brgya rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol du lo la dbyu gu drug cu drug cu'i bdag nyid kyi nyin zhag drug cu lhag pa'i sum brgya rnams te /
translated: Thus, externally, in a year, there are three hundred and sixty days of sixty breaths each.

original: nang du nyin zhag la dbugs drug cu drug cu'i bdag nyid rnams so //
analyzed: nang du nyin zhag la dbugs drug cu drug cu'i bdag nyid rnams so //
translated: Internally, they are of the nature of sixty breaths each day and night.

original: de ltar dbyu gu dgu brgya dgu brgya'i bdag nyid kyi phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar dbyu gu dgu brgya dgu brgya'i bdag nyid kyi phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams te /
translated: Thus, there are twenty-four sides of the nature of nine hundred and ninety breaths each.

original: nang du ni dbugs dgu brgya dgu brgya'i bdag nyid ces pa'o /
analyzed: nang du ni dbugs dgu brgya dgu brgya'i bdag nyid ces pa'o /
translated: Internally, they are of the nature of nine hundred and ninety breaths each.

original: @91b de bzhin du phyi rol du dbyu gu brgya phrag bco brgyad bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi zla ba bcu gnyis rnams te /
analyzed: @91b de bzhin du phyi rol du dbyu gu brgya phrag bco brgyad bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi zla ba bcu gnyis rnams te /
translated: Similarly, externally, there are twelve months of the nature of eighteen hundred breaths each.

original: nang du ni dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid ces pa'o //🔽phyi rol du dbyu gu brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid kyi dus drug rnams te /
analyzed: nang du ni dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid ces pa'o // phyi rol du dbyu gu brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid kyi dus drug rnams te /
translated: Internally, they are of the nature of eighteen hundred breaths each.🔽Externally, there are six seasons of the nature of thirty-six hundred breaths each.

original: nang du ni dbugs brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug sum cu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni dbugs brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug sum cu rtsa drug gi bdag nyid ces pa'o //
translated: Internally, they are of the nature of thirty-six hundred breaths each.

original: phyi rol du dbyu gu brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi dus bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: phyi rol du dbyu gu brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi dus bzhi rnams te /
translated: Externally, there are four times, each consisting of 5,400 breaths.

original: nang du ni dbugs brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni dbugs brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid ces pa'o //
translated: Internally, there are 5,400 breaths.

original: phyi rol du dbyu gu brgya phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis brgya phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid dus gsum mo //
analyzed: phyi rol du dbyu gu brgya phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis brgya phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid dus gsum mo //
translated: Externally, there are three times, each consisting of 7,200 breaths.

original: nang du ni dbugs brgya phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis brgya phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni dbugs brgya phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis brgya phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid ces pa'o //
translated: Internally, there are 7,200 breaths.

original: phyi rol du bgrod pa gnyis la so sor dbyu gu khri brgyad brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag bcu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol du bgrod pa gnyis la so sor dbyu gu khri brgyad brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag bcu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Externally, there are two paths, each consisting of 10,800 breaths.

original: nang du dbugs khri brgyad brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag bcu'i bdag nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: nang du dbugs khri brgyad brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag bcu'i bdag nyid ces pa'o //
translated: Internally, there are 10,800 breaths.

original: de ltar na phyi rol du nyi ma'i zhag so so la nyin mtshan gyi dbyu gu drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol du nyi ma'i zhag so so la nyin mtshan gyi dbyu gu drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rnams te /
translated: Thus, externally, in each solar day, there are twenty-one thousand six hundred muhurtas, or periods of time.

original: nang du ni nyin zhag so sor lus can rnams kyi dbugs rnams so //
analyzed: nang du ni nyin zhag so sor lus can rnams kyi dbugs rnams so //
translated: Internally, in each day, there are that many breaths of embodied beings.

original: 'dir mi rnams kyi dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la lus skyes srin bu'i rigs rnams kyi nyin mtshan no //🔽de la 'di nyid kyi khyad par gyis dus rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir mi rnams kyi dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la lus skyes srin bu'i rigs rnams kyi nyin mtshan no // de la 'di nyid kyi khyad par gyis dus rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Here, the day and night of the worms born on the human body is the exhalation and inhalation of the breath of humans.

original: 'dir mi rnams kyi zla ba ni yi dags rnams kyi nyin mtshan no //
analyzed: 'dir mi rnams kyi zla ba ni yi dags rnams kyi nyin mtshan no //
translated: Here, the day and night of the pretas is the month of humans.

original: lha min rnams kyi lo ni lha ma yin rnams kyi lo skor drug cu'o //
analyzed: lha min rnams kyi lo ni lha ma yin rnams kyi lo skor drug cu'o //
translated: The sixty years of the asuras is the year of the asuras.

original: dbugs kyi 'khor lo'i grangs kyi lo ni nus pa zhes pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyin mtshan no //
analyzed: dbugs kyi 'khor lo'i grangs kyi lo ni nus pa zhes pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyin mtshan no //
translated: The year of the bodhisattvas is the day and night of the powerful ones, which is calculated by the number of breaths in the wheel of the breath.

original: nyin zhag de nyid gtso bo'i dbugs gcig ste /
analyzed: nyin zhag de nyid gtso bo'i dbugs gcig ste /
translated: That day and night is one breath of the principal one.

original: sems can gyi don dang snying brtse ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don dang snying brtse ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: It is for the sake of the welfare of sentient beings and out of compassion.

original: de ltar dus kyi khyad par nyin zhag so so la thams cad du rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar dus kyi khyad par nyin zhag so so la thams cad du rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the special time should be understood in each day and night.

original: rgyud dang rgyud gzhan du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyud dang rgyud gzhan du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata taught this in the tantras and other tantras.

original: de ltar gdan bzhi la sogs pa rnams kyis 'khor lo sdom pa'i dus kyi khyad par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gdan bzhi la sogs pa rnams kyis 'khor lo sdom pa'i dus kyi khyad par shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the special time of Cakrasaṃvara should be understood by means of the Caturpīṭha and other tantras,

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud thos pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dis ni mkhas pa rnams kyi gdan bzhi @92a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud thos pa med pa'i phyir ro // 'dis ni mkhas pa rnams kyi gdan bzhi @92a * //
translated: because the root tantra is not heard.

original: la sogs pa'i rgyud du rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa la longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa mkhas pa rnams kyis khong du chud par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rgyud du rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa la longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa mkhas pa rnams kyis khong du chud par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that the wise should understand the conduct of yoginīs in the Caturpīṭha and other tantras, in terms of enjoyment, dissolution, and mastery.

original: dus kyi khyad par gyis phyi rol dang nang du mchod pa'i cho ga'i nges pa'o /
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par gyis phyi rol dang nang du mchod pa'i cho ga'i nges pa'o /
translated: This is the rule for external and internal worship by means of the special time.

original: // / da ni rigs kyi pho nya mo sum cu rtsa drug brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni rigs kyi pho nya mo sum cu rtsa drug brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the thirty-six types of messenger of the families should be mentioned.

original: sum cu rtsa bdun na ni rigs ldan ma'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun na ni rigs ldan ma'o //
translated: The one of the thirty-seven families is the kṣatriya woman.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud 'dir rdo rje phag mo ni rigs ldan ma'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud 'dir rdo rje phag mo ni rigs ldan ma'o //
translated: In this root tantra, Vajravarahi is of the warrior caste.

original: rigs med pa ni g-yung mo'o //
analyzed: rigs med pa ni g-yung mo'o //
translated: The casteless is the outcaste.

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni dmangs rigs ma'o //🔽l'a ma ni rgyal rigs ma'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni dmangs rigs ma'o // l'a ma ni rgyal rigs ma'o //
translated: The dakini is of the servant caste.🔽The la is of the royal caste.

original: dum skyes ma ni rje'u rigs ma'o //
analyzed: dum skyes ma ni rje'u rigs ma'o //
translated: The half-woman is of the priestly caste.

original: gzugs can mo ni bram ze mo'o //🔽khva gdong ma ni kla klo ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs can mo ni bram ze mo'o // khva gdong ma ni kla klo ma'o //
translated: The form-woman is of the Brahmin caste.🔽The crow-faced is of the barbarian caste.

original: 'ug gdong ma ni 'phyag pa ma'o //🔽khyi gdong ma ni gtum mo'o //
analyzed: 'ug gdong ma ni 'phyag pa ma'o // khyi gdong ma ni gtum mo'o //
translated: The owl-faced is the sweeper.🔽The dog-faced is the butcher.

original: phag gdong ma ni stag gzig ma'o //🔽gshin rje brtan ma ni ri khrod ma'o //
analyzed: phag gdong ma ni stag gzig ma'o // gshin rje brtan ma ni ri khrod ma'o //
translated: The pig-faced is the tiger-hunter.🔽The Yamadhatri is the forest-woman.

original: gshin rje pho nya mo ni bhi lli'o //
analyzed: gshin rje pho nya mo ni bhi lli'o //
translated: The Yamadhuti is the bhiksuni.

original: gshin rje mche ba ma ni pukka s'i'o //🔽gshin rje 'joms ma ni smyon thabs ma'o //
analyzed: gshin rje mche ba ma ni pukka s'i'o // gshin rje 'joms ma ni smyon thabs ma'o //
translated: The Yamadamstri is the pukkasl.🔽The Yamamathani is the mad woman.

original: rab gtum ma ni 'od zer mkhan ma'o //🔽gtum mig ma ni chang mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: rab gtum ma ni 'od zer mkhan ma'o // gtum mig ma ni chang mkhan ma'o //
translated: The Prachandali is the oil-woman.🔽The Candali is the wine-woman.

original: 'od ldan ma ni phreng ba mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: 'od ldan ma ni phreng ba mkhan ma'o //
translated: The Marici is the garland-maker.

original: sna chen ma ni gser mgar mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: sna chen ma ni gser mgar mkhan ma'o //
translated: The Maha-ajana is the goldsmith.

original: dpa' bo'i blo can ni khron pa mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i blo can ni khron pa mkhan ma'o //
translated: The Viramatl is the well-digger.

original: mi'u thung ma ni smyig ma mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: mi'u thung ma ni smyig ma mkhan ma'o //
translated: The dwarf is the bamboo worker.

original: lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni 'khar ba mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni 'khar ba mkhan ma'o //
translated: The queen of Lanka is the cane worker.

original: shing grib ma ni nor bu mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: shing grib ma ni nor bu mkhan ma'o //
translated: The tree-shaded one is the jeweler.

original: sa srungs ma ni lcags mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: sa srungs ma ni lcags mkhan ma'o //
translated: The earth-protector is the iron worker.

original: 'jigs byed chen mo ni rgya skyegs mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen mo ni rgya skyegs mkhan ma'o //
translated: The great frightening one is the lac dye worker.

original: rlung shugs ma ni srin pa la mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: rlung shugs ma ni srin pa la mkhan ma'o //
translated: The wind-swift one is the spider worker.

original: chang 'thung ma ni til mar mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: chang 'thung ma ni til mar mkhan ma'o //
translated: The beer-drinker is the oil worker.

original: lha mo sngo bsangs ma ni 'breg mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: lha mo sngo bsangs ma ni 'breg mkhan ma'o //
translated: The blue goddess is the barber.

original: shin tu bzang mo ni ko lpags mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: shin tu bzang mo ni ko lpags mkhan ma'o //
translated: The very good one is the leather worker.

original: rta rna ma ni shing mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: rta rna ma ni shing mkhan ma'o //
translated: The horse-eared one is the carpenter.

original: mkha' 'gro gdong ma ni gling bu mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro gdong ma ni gling bu mkhan ma'o //
translated: The ḍākinī-faced one is the flute worker.

original: 'khor lo'i shugs can ma ni sha 'tshong ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i shugs can ma ni sha 'tshong ma'o //
translated: The wheel-swift one is the butcher.

original: dum skyes ma ni g-yos mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: dum skyes ma ni g-yos mkhan ma'o //
translated: The part-born one is the cook.

original: shoondi ni ni tshem bu ma'o //
analyzed: shoondi ni ni tshem bu ma'o //
translated: The śauṇḍinī is the tailor.

original: 'khor lo'i go cha ma ni gar mkhan ma'o //🔽shin tu dpa' mo ni tshos mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i go cha ma ni gar mkhan ma'o // shin tu dpa' mo ni tshos mkhan ma'o //
translated: The wheel-clad one is the dancer.🔽The very brave one is the dyer.

original: stobs chen ma ni nya pa ma'o //
analyzed: stobs chen ma ni nya pa ma'o //
translated: The powerful one is the fisherman.

original: 'khor los sgyur ma ni rdza mkhan ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ma ni rdza mkhan ma'o //
translated: The Cakravarmiṇī is the potter.

original: brtson 'grus chen mo ni smad 'tshong ma'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen mo ni smad 'tshong ma'o //
translated: The Mahāvīryā is the prostitute.

original: 'di rnams rim pa ji lta bas phyi rol du longs spyod pa'i nyin zhag dang longs spyod pa'i dus la sngar brjod pa'i las rab 'byam dang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub @92b pa'i don du sngags pas mchod par bya'o zhes pa rigs kyi pho nya mo mchod
analyzed: 'di rnams rim pa ji lta bas phyi rol du longs spyod pa'i nyin zhag dang longs spyod pa'i dus la sngar brjod pa'i las rab 'byam dang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub @92b pa'i don du sngags pas mchod par bya'o zhes pa rigs kyi pho nya mo mchod
translated: The mantrin should worship these in sequence externally on the day of enjoyment and at the time of enjoyment for the sake of accomplishing the various activities and mundane powers that were previously mentioned.

original: pa'i cho ga bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o /
analyzed: pa'i cho ga bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o /
translated: This is the Bhagavān’s definition of the rite of worshiping the messengers of the families.

original: // / da ni dam tshig gi pho nya mo rang gi gzugs yongs su bsgyur ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni dam tshig gi pho nya mo rang gi gzugs yongs su bsgyur ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, one should speak of the transformation of the forms of the pledge messengers.

original: 'dir rdo rje phag mo ni rigs ldan ma ste /
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje phag mo ni rigs ldan ma ste /
translated: Here, the Vajravarāhī is the kṣatriyā.

original: thams cad du gzugs thams cad yongs su bsgyur ba ma'o //
analyzed: thams cad du gzugs thams cad yongs su bsgyur ba ma'o //
translated: She is the transformer of all forms everywhere.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ni khyi mo'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ni khyi mo'o //
translated: The Vajradākinī is the bitch.

original: l'a ma ni rgod ma'o //
analyzed: l'a ma ni rgod ma'o //
translated: The Lāmā is the mare.

original: dum skyes ma ni glang ma'o //🔽gzugs can ma ni ba'o //
analyzed: dum skyes ma ni glang ma'o // gzugs can ma ni ba'o //
translated: The Khaṇḍarohā is the elephant.

original: rab gtum ma ni lug mo'o //
analyzed: rab gtum ma ni lug mo'o //
translated: The Rūpiṇī is the cow.🔽The Pracaṇḍā is the ewe.

original: gtum mig ma ni ra mo'o //
analyzed: gtum mig ma ni ra mo'o //
translated: Caṇḍākṣī is a goat.

original: 'od ldan ma ni ri dags mo'o //🔽sna chan ma ni bong mo'o //
analyzed: 'od ldan ma ni ri dags mo'o // sna chan ma ni bong mo'o //
translated: Prabhāvatī is a deer.🔽Karṇaprāvaraṇā is an ass.

original: dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni phag mo'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni phag mo'o //
translated: Śūrpaparikṣā is a pig.

original: mi'u thung ma ni rnga mo'o //🔽lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni 'brog dgon pa'i khyi mo'o //
analyzed: mi'u thung ma ni rnga mo'o // lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni 'brog dgon pa'i khyi mo'o //
translated: Vāmanā is a camel.🔽Laṅkeśvarī is a wild bitch.

original: shing grib ma ni 'brog dgon pa'i seng ge mo'o //
analyzed: shing grib ma ni 'brog dgon pa'i seng ge mo'o //
translated: Vṛkṣā is a wild lioness.

original: sa srungs ma ni bse mo'o //
analyzed: sa srungs ma ni bse mo'o //
translated: Bhūteśvarī is a wild pig.

original: 'jigs byed chen mo ni stag mo'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen mo ni stag mo'o //
translated: Mahābhairavā is a tigress.

original: rlung shugs ma ni dom mo'o //🔽chang 'thung ma ni spre mo'o //
analyzed: rlung shugs ma ni dom mo'o // chang 'thung ma ni spre mo'o //
translated: Vāyuvegā is a bear.🔽Mārajitā is a monkey.

original: lha mo sngo bsangs ma ni 'bri mo'o //🔽shin tu bzang mo ni ce sbyang ma'o //
analyzed: lha mo sngo bsangs ma ni 'bri mo'o // shin tu bzang mo ni ce sbyang ma'o //
translated: Śyāmādevī is a hyena.🔽Subhadrā is a jackal.

original: rta rnam ni sram mo'o //🔽mkha' 'gro gdong ma ni byi la mo'o //
analyzed: rta rnam ni sram mo'o // mkha' 'gro gdong ma ni byi la mo'o //
translated: Hayakarṇī is an otter.🔽Dākinī is a cat.

original: 'khor lo'i shugs can ma ni kumbhi r'i'o //🔽dum skyes ma ni 'gron bu mo'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i shugs can ma ni kumbhi r'i'o // dum skyes ma ni 'gron bu mo'o //
translated: Cakravartinī is a tortoise.🔽Khaṇḍarohā is a porcupine.

original: shoo ndi ni karka t'i'o //
analyzed: shoo ndi ni karka t'i'o //
translated: Śauṇḍinī is a crocodile.

original: 'khor lo'i go cha ma ni nya mo'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i go cha ma ni nya mo'o //
translated: Cakravartinī is a fish.

original: shin tu dpa' mo ni chu srin mo'o //
analyzed: shin tu dpa' mo ni chu srin mo'o //
translated: Śūkarāsyā is a sea monster.

original: stobs chen mo ni sbal pa mo'o //
analyzed: stobs chen mo ni sbal pa mo'o //
translated: The great powerful one is a female frog.

original: 'khor los sgyur ma ni rus sbal mo'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ma ni rus sbal mo'o //
translated: The cakra-turning one is a female tortoise.

original: brtson 'grus chen mo ni dung mo'o //🔽kha gdong ma ni go dhi'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen mo ni dung mo'o // kha gdong ma ni go dhi'o //
translated: The great effort one is a female conch.🔽The face-mouth one is a female godhika.

original: 'ug gdong ma ni byi ba mo'o //
analyzed: 'ug gdong ma ni byi ba mo'o //
translated: The owl-faced one is a female mouse.

original: khyi gdong ma ni sh'a li dza ti ki'o //
analyzed: khyi gdong ma ni sh'a li dza ti ki'o //
translated: The dog-faced one is a female śāli jātikā.

original: phag gdong ma ni spre'u mo'o //🔽gshin rje brtan ma ni ri bong ma'o //
analyzed: phag gdong ma ni spre'u mo'o // gshin rje brtan ma ni ri bong ma'o //
translated: The pig-faced one is a female monkey.🔽The stable one of the Lord of Death is a female rabbit.

original: gshin rje pho nya mo ni gzugs mo'o //
analyzed: gshin rje pho nya mo ni gzugs mo'o //
translated: The messenger of the Lord of Death is a female gaur.🔽The fang of the Lord of Death is an īṣṭakī.

original: gshin rje mche ba mo ni aishta ki'o //
analyzed: gshin rje mche ba mo ni aishta ki'o //
translated: The conqueror of the Lord of Death is a female lizard.

original: gshin rje 'joms ma ni rtsangs pa ma'o zhes pa thang la spyod pa dang / chu la spyod pa dang / nags la spyod pa dang / gzugs yongs su bsgyur ba'i dam tshig gi lha mo sum cu rtsa drug po de rnams kyi rang bzhin gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas shes par gyur pa de'i tshe dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: gshin rje 'joms ma ni rtsangs pa ma'o zhes pa thang la spyod pa dang / chu la spyod pa dang / nags la spyod pa dang / gzugs yongs su bsgyur ba'i dam tshig gi lha mo sum cu rtsa drug po de rnams kyi rang bzhin gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas shes par gyur pa de'i tshe dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro /
translated: These are the thirty-six goddesses of the commitments of the land-goers, the water-goers, the forest-goers, and the complete transformation of form.

original: // / da ni mkha' la spyod pa'i gzugs yongs su bsgyur ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni mkha' la spyod pa'i gzugs yongs su bsgyur ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the transformation of the form of the sky-farers should be stated.

original: 'dir rdo rje phag mo ni rigs ldan ma ste /
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje phag mo ni rigs ldan ma ste /
translated: Here, Vajravarahi is a khattika.

original: gzugs thams cad yongs su bsgyur ba mo'o //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad yongs su bsgyur ba mo'o //
translated: She is the transformer of all forms.

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni ts'a ta ki'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni ts'a ta ki'o //
translated: The dakini is a chattaka.

original: l'a ma ni ne tso @93a * //
analyzed: l'a ma ni ne tso @93a * //
translated: The lamini is a parrot.

original: ma'o ; / dum skyes ma ni ri skegs ma'o //
analyzed: ma'o ; / dum skyes ma ni ri skegs ma'o //
translated: The Khaṇḍarohā is a myna bird.

original: gzugs can ma ni khu byug ma'o //🔽rab gtum ni l'a mo'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma ni khu byug ma'o // rab gtum ni l'a mo'o //
translated: The Rūpiṇī is a cuckoo.🔽The Pracaṇḍā is a laṃbaka.

original: gtum mig ma ni phug ron ma'o //
analyzed: gtum mig ma ni phug ron ma'o //
translated: The Caṇḍākṣī is a dove.

original: 'od ldan ma ni bya dkar mo'o //
analyzed: 'od ldan ma ni bya dkar mo'o //
translated: The Jvālinī is a white bird.

original: sna chen ma ni tsa ta ki'o //
analyzed: sna chen ma ni tsa ta ki'o //
translated: The Mahānāsā is a chattaka.

original: dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni gyur pa mo'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni gyur pa mo'o //
translated: The Śūraprajñā is a swan.

original: mi'u thung ma ni ngang pa ma'o //
analyzed: mi'u thung ma ni ngang pa ma'o //
translated: The Vāmanā is a goose.

original: lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni hor pa mo'o //🔽shing grib ma ni ljon shing dgra ma'o //
analyzed: lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni hor pa mo'o // shing grib ma ni ljon shing dgra ma'o //
translated: The Laṅkeśvarī is a peacock.🔽The Vṛkṣā is a deer.

original: sa srungs ma ni bya rog mo'o //🔽'jigs byed chen mo ni bya rgod ma'o //
analyzed: sa srungs ma ni bya rog mo'o // 'jigs byed chen mo ni bya rgod ma'o //
translated: The Pṛthivī is a crow.🔽The Mahābhairavā is a vulture.

original: rlung shugs ma ni 'ug pa mo'o //
analyzed: rlung shugs ma ni 'ug pa mo'o //
translated: The Marutāṭavī is an owl.

original: chang 'thung ma ni ri dags dgra ma'o //
analyzed: chang 'thung ma ni ri dags dgra ma'o //
translated: The Surābhakṣī is a lion.

original: lha mo sngo bsangs can ma ni gtsug pud can ma'o //
analyzed: lha mo sngo bsangs can ma ni gtsug pud can ma'o //
translated: Goddess Śyāmādevī is Jaṭila.

original: shin tu bzang mo ni bya gag mo'o //🔽rta rna ma ni bhe da ni'o //
analyzed: shin tu bzang mo ni bya gag mo'o // rta rna ma ni bhe da ni'o //
translated: Subhadrā is Kukkuṭī.🔽Hayakarṇī is Bhadreṇī.

original: mkha' 'gro gdong ma ni 'ol ba mo'o //🔽'khor lo'i shugs can ma ni khrung khrung ma'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro gdong ma ni 'ol ba mo'o // 'khor lo'i shugs can ma ni khrung khrung ma'o //
translated: Ḍākinīmukha is Kākī.🔽Cakravīriṇī is Haṃsī.

original: dum skyes ma ni khu byug mig ma'o //
analyzed: dum skyes ma ni khu byug mig ma'o //
translated: Khaṇḍarohā is Kokila.

original: shoo ndi ni ni ri ra dza ki'o //
analyzed: shoo ndi ni ni ri ra dza ki'o //
translated: Śauṇḍinī is Rīrajakī.

original: 'khor lo'i go cha ma ni bha ga ba ti'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i go cha ma ni bha ga ba ti'o //
translated: Cakravartī is Bhagevatī.

original: shin tu dpa' mo ni titti ri'o //
analyzed: shin tu dpa' mo ni titti ri'o //
translated: Mahāvīryā is Tittiri.

original: stobs chen mo ni bzhad mo'o //
analyzed: stobs chen mo ni bzhad mo'o //
translated: Mahābalā is Hāsī.

original: 'khor los sgyur ma ni chu'i bya rog ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ma ni chu'i bya rog ma'o //
translated: Cakravartinī is Jalakāka.

original: brtson 'grus chen mo ni chu skyar mo'o //🔽khva gdong ma ni mig sngon mo'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen mo ni chu skyar mo'o // khva gdong ma ni mig sngon mo'o //
translated: Mahāvīryā is Kākī.🔽Kākarohā is Śyenī.

original: 'ug gdong ma ni tsa ko ri'o //
analyzed: 'ug gdong ma ni tsa ko ri'o //
translated: Ulūkakanthā is Cakori.

original: khyi gdong ma ni aa ni la ma'o //🔽phag gdong ma ni pha wang ma'o //
analyzed: khyi gdong ma ni aa ni la ma'o // phag gdong ma ni pha wang ma'o //
translated: Śvanamukha is Aṇilā.🔽Sūkaramukha is Śārikā.

original: gshin rje brtan ma ni pukka mi'o //
analyzed: gshin rje brtan ma ni pukka mi'o //
translated: Yamadhṛk is Pukkasi.

original: gshin rje pho nya mo ni di da ti bhi'o //
analyzed: gshin rje pho nya mo ni di da ti bhi'o //
translated: Yamadūti is Dīptī.

original: gshin rje mche ba ma ni bhe rundi 'o //
analyzed: gshin rje mche ba ma ni bhe rundi 'o //
translated: Yamadamṣṭrī is Bheruṇḍī.

original: gshin rje 'joms ma ni aambha ri ka ma'o zhes pa nam mkha' la spyod pa'i gzugs yongs su bsgyur ba'i rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: gshin rje 'joms ma ni aambha ri ka ma'o zhes pa nam mkha' la spyod pa'i gzugs yongs su bsgyur ba'i rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: These are the thirty-seven yoginis who transform their aerial forms.

original: thang la spyod pa dang chu la spyod pa dang nam mkha' la spyod pa 'di rnams phan tshun bsad pa la sogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bral ba ji ltar rnyed pa'i sde /
analyzed: thang la spyod pa dang chu la spyod pa dang nam mkha' la spyod pa 'di rnams phan tshun bsad pa la sogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bral ba ji ltar rnyed pa'i sde /
translated: These who move on the earth, in the water, and in the sky are free from the sin of mutual killing, and the assembly of whatever is found

original: bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa rnams 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas ril bur byas pa bzung nas dur khrod kyi sa la bsgrubs te des gsung rdo rje la sogs pa mchod pa'i rdzas rnams rab tu bsang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa rnams 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas ril bur byas pa bzung nas dur khrod kyi sa la bsgrubs te des gsung rdo rje la sogs pa mchod pa'i rdzas rnams rab tu bsang bar bya'o //
translated: is the five nectars. Having made them into pills according to the procedure that will be explained, one should practice in a charnel ground. With that, one should purify the offering substances such as vajra speech and so on.

original: de nas sbyang ba dang rtogs pa dang rab tu 'bar ba dang bdud rtsir byas nas /
analyzed: de nas sbyang ba dang rtogs pa dang rab tu 'bar ba dang bdud rtsir byas nas /
translated: Then, having purified, realized, ignited, and made into nectar,

original: ji ltar rnyed pa'i dam tshig gi rdzas rnams 'khor lo la mchod pa'i dus su sngags pas rnal 'byor ma rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa'i dam tshig gi rdzas rnams 'khor lo la mchod pa'i dus su sngags pas rnal 'byor ma rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: the pledge substances that are found should be offered to the yoginis by the mantrin at the time of offering to the wheel.

original: sgom pa'i dus dang kun du spyod pa'i dus dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su bdag nyid kyi zhal @93b du ril bu gzhug par bya zhing /
analyzed: sgom pa'i dus dang kun du spyod pa'i dus dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su bdag nyid kyi zhal @93b du ril bu gzhug par bya zhing /
translated: At the time of meditation, at the time of conduct, and at the time of union, one should insert the pill into one’s own mouth.🔽And into the mouth of the wisdom face and the hero and yoginī goddesses.

original: shes rab kyi zhal dang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyi zhal du yang ngo zhes pa mchod pa'i cho ga'i nges pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi zhal dang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyi zhal du yang ngo zhes pa mchod pa'i cho ga'i nges pa'o /
translated: This is the definition of the rite of offering.

original: // / da ni phyi rol dang nang du gnas la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma kun du rgyu ba'i gnas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni phyi rol dang nang du gnas la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma kun du rgyu ba'i gnas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the places of the wandering yoginīs, such as the external and internal abodes, will be described.

original: phyi rol du ri rab kyi rtse mor sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du ri rab kyi rtse mor sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la'o //
translated: Externally, on the summit of Mount Meru, on the center of a multicolored lotus.

original: nang du ni gsang ba'i padma las te /
analyzed: nang du ni gsang ba'i padma las te /
translated: Internally, from the secret lotus.

original: rtsa ba'i gnas la rdo rje phag mo rigs ldan ma'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i gnas la rdo rje phag mo rigs ldan ma'o //
translated: In the root abode, Vajravārāhī is the kṣatriya.

original: padma'i shar gyi 'dab ma la snying ga'i padmar bdag gi gdan la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: padma'i shar gyi 'dab ma la snying ga'i padmar bdag gi gdan la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: In the eastern petal of the lotus, on the seat of oneself in the heart lotus, is Vajraḍāka.

original: lho'i 'dab ma la mgrin pa'i padmar gzhan gyi gdan la l'a ma'o //
analyzed: lho'i 'dab ma la mgrin pa'i padmar gzhan gyi gdan la l'a ma'o //
translated: In the southern petal, on the seat of another in the throat lotus, is Lāmā.

original: nub kyi 'dab ma la lte ba'i padmar sngags kyi gdan la dum skyes ma'o //
analyzed: nub kyi 'dab ma la lte ba'i padmar sngags kyi gdan la dum skyes ma'o //
translated: On the western petal, in the navel lotus, on a mantra seat, is Khaṇḍarohā.

original: byang gi 'dab ma la dpral ba'i padmar de kho na'i gdan la gzugs can ma'o //
analyzed: byang gi 'dab ma la dpral ba'i padmar de kho na'i gdan la gzugs can ma'o //
translated: On the northern petal, in the forehead lotus, on a reality seat, is Rūpiṇī.🔽On the filament, in the uṣṇīṣa lotus, on all seats, is Śrī Heruka.

original: ze'u 'bru la gtsug tor gyi padmar thams cad kyi gdan la dpal he ru ka'o zhes pa ye shes kyi 'khor lo mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: ze'u 'bru la gtsug tor gyi padmar thams cad kyi gdan la dpal he ru ka'o zhes pa ye shes kyi 'khor lo mchod par bya'o //
translated: Thus one should worship the wheel of pristine consciousness.

original: de nas nam mkha' la thugs kyi 'khor lor ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad po rnams su shar gyi rtsibs la /
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' la thugs kyi 'khor lor ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad po rnams su shar gyi rtsibs la /
translated: Then, in the sky, in the wheel of mind, in the eight directions of Mount Meru, on the eastern spoke,

original: p'urnna gi rir spyi bo la rab gtum ma dang thod pa'i dum bu'o //🔽lho'i rtsibs la dz'a landha rar spyi gtsug tu gtum mig ma dang keng rus chen po'o //
analyzed: p'urnna gi rir spyi bo la rab gtum ma dang thod pa'i dum bu'o // lho'i rtsibs la dz'a landha rar spyi gtsug tu gtum mig ma dang keng rus chen po'o //
translated: in Pūrva, in the head, is Pracaṇḍā and Kapālasphoṭa.🔽On the southern spoke, in Jālandhara, in the head, is Caṇḍākṣī and Mahākuṇḍalī.

original: nub kyi rtsibs la audi y'a nar rna ba g-yas par steng du 'od ldan ma dang keng rus so //
analyzed: nub kyi rtsibs la audi y'a nar rna ba g-yas par steng du 'od ldan ma dang keng rus so //
translated: On the western spoke, in Oḍiyāna, in the right ear, above, is Marīci and Kuṇḍalin.

original: byang gi rtsibs la aarbu dar mgrin pa'i rgyab kyi steng du sna chen ma dang mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa'o zhes pa dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dbang bo'i dbang phyug ma rnams gnas bzhi po rnams su longs spyod par 'khor ba ni g-yas skor gyis so //
analyzed: byang gi rtsibs la aarbu dar mgrin pa'i rgyab kyi steng du sna chen ma dang mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa'o zhes pa dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dbang bo'i dbang phyug ma rnams gnas bzhi po rnams su longs spyod par 'khor ba ni g-yas skor gyis so //
translated: Thus, the goddesses of the lords of the directions together with the heroes enjoy the four places in a clockwise circle.

original: da nas dbang ldan gyi rtsibs la go d'a ba rir rna ba g-yon pa'i steng du dpa' bo'i blo can ma dang chang dgra'o //
analyzed: da nas dbang ldan gyi rtsibs la go d'a ba rir rna ba g-yon pa'i steng du dpa' bo'i blo can ma dang chang dgra'o //
translated: Now, on the spoke of Indra, in Godāvarī, on the left ear, is Śūrcakṣu and Surāpā.

original: rlung gi rtsibs la r'a me shva rir smin ma'i dbus su mi'u thung ma dang 'od dpag med no //
analyzed: rlung gi rtsibs la r'a me shva rir smin ma'i dbus su mi'u thung ma dang 'od dpag med no //
translated: On the spoke of Vāyu, in Rāmeśvara, in the middle of the eyebrows, is Vāmana and Amitābha.

original: bden bral gyi rtsibs la de w'i ko tar mig gnyis po la langka'i dbang phyug ma dang rdo rje 'od do //
analyzed: bden bral gyi rtsibs la de w'i ko tar mig gnyis po la langka'i dbang phyug ma dang rdo rje 'od do //
translated: On the spoke of Nirṛti, in Devakōṭṭa, on the two eyes, is Laṅkeśvarī and Vajraprabhā.

original: me'i rtsibs la m'a la war /
analyzed: me'i rtsibs la m'a la war /
translated: On the spoke of Agni, in Mālava,

original: dpung pa'i rtsa ba la shing grib ma dang rdo rje lus so zhes pa dpa' bo dang bcas pa dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams nye ba'i gnas bzhi po rnams su longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: dpung pa'i rtsa ba la shing grib ma dang rdo rje lus so zhes pa dpa' bo dang bcas pa dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams nye ba'i gnas bzhi po rnams su longs spyod pa ste /
translated: At the base of the arms are the trees, and the vajra body, the heroines and the hero heroines, the heroines, enjoy the four near sanctuaries.

original: 'khor ba ni g-yon skor gyis so //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni g-yon skor gyis so //
translated: The wheel of life is to the left.

original: de ltar gnas dang nye ba'i gnas longs spyod pa mkha' la spyod pa la thugs kyi 'khor lo la @94a * //
analyzed: de ltar gnas dang nye ba'i gnas longs spyod pa mkha' la spyod pa la thugs kyi 'khor lo la @94a * //
translated: Thus, the enjoyment of the sanctuaries and the near sanctuaries is in the wheel of mind of those who fly in the sky.

original: mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings to them.

original: de nas sa'i khor yug la ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad po rnams su gsung gi 'khor lor shar gyi rtsibs la k'a ma r'u par mchan khung gnyis su sa srungs ma dang myu gu can no //
analyzed: de nas sa'i khor yug la ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad po rnams su gsung gi 'khor lor shar gyi rtsibs la k'a ma r'u par mchan khung gnyis su sa srungs ma dang myu gu can no //
translated: Then, on the outer rim of the earth, in the eight directions of Meru, in the wheel of speech, on the eastern spoke, in Kāmarūpa, in the two armpits are Pṛthivī and Aśoka.🔽On the southern spoke, in Oḍḍiyāna, in the two breasts are Mahābhairavā and Vajrānanta.

original: lho'i rtsibs la ao ter nu ma zung la 'jigs byed chen mo dang rdo rje ral pa can no zhes pa zhing dag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: lho'i rtsibs la ao ter nu ma zung la 'jigs byed chen mo dang rdo rje ral pa can no zhes pa zhing dag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the heroes and the heroines, the hero heroines, enjoy the pure fields.

original: nub kyi rtsibs la tri sha ku ner lte ba la rlung shugs ma dang dpa' bo chen po'o //
analyzed: nub kyi rtsibs la tri sha ku ner lte ba la rlung shugs ma dang dpa' bo chen po'o //
translated: On the western spoke, in Triśākuni, at the navel, is Māruta and Mahāvīra.

original: byang gi rtsibs la ko sa lar sna rtse la chang 'thung ma dang rdo rje h'um mdzad do zhes pa nye ba'i zhing dag la dpa' bo dang dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byang gi rtsibs la ko sa lar sna rtse la chang 'thung ma dang rdo rje h'um mdzad do zhes pa nye ba'i zhing dag la dpa' bo dang dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //
translated: On the northern spoke, in Kosala, at the tip of the nose, is Surābhakṣi and Vajrahūṃkāra. Thus, the heroes and heroines enjoy the adjacent fields.

original: de ltar zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dag la longs spyod pa ste 'khor ba ni g-yas skor gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dag la longs spyod pa ste 'khor ba ni g-yas skor gyis so //
translated: Thus, the enjoyment in the fields and adjacent fields is clockwise.

original: de nas dbang ldan gyi rtsibs la ka linggar kha la lha mo sngo bsangs ma dang rab tu bzang po'o //
analyzed: de nas dbang ldan gyi rtsibs la ka linggar kha la lha mo sngo bsangs ma dang rab tu bzang po'o //
translated: Then, in the spoke of Indra, in Kaliṅga, in the mouth, is Śyāmādevī and Subhadra.

original: rlung gi rtsibs la lamba kar mgrin pa la shin tu bzang mo dang rdo rje bzang po'o zhes pa tshando ha dag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi rtsibs la lamba kar mgrin pa la shin tu bzang mo dang rdo rje bzang po'o zhes pa tshando ha dag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //
translated: In the spoke of Vāyu, in Lampāka, in the throat, is Subhadrā and Vajrasubhadra. Thus, the heroes and heroines enjoy the caṇḍolahas.

original: bden bral gyi rtsibs la k'anytsir snying ga la rta rnam dang 'jigs byed chen po'o //
analyzed: bden bral gyi rtsibs la k'anytsir snying ga la rta rnam dang 'jigs byed chen po'o //
translated: On the spoke of the southwest, in Kāñcī, in the heart, are Hayagrīva and Mahābhairava.🔽On the spoke of the south, in the navel, is Ḍākinī. On the spoke of the southeast, in Pūrṇagiri, in the right knee, is Rūpiṇī. On the spoke of the east, in Devikoṭa, in the right ankle, is Caṇḍālī. On the spoke of the northeast, in Oḍra, in the left ankle, is Pukkasī. On the spoke of the north, in Kāmarūpa, in the left knee, is Ḍākinī. On the spoke of the northwest, in Kulatā, in the navel, is Rūpiṇī. On the spoke of the west, in Godāvarī, in the heart, is Caṇḍālī. On the spoke of the southwest, in Rāmeśvara, in the throat, is Ghasmarī.

original: me'i rtsibs la hi ma la yar mdo mar bar du mkha' 'gro gdong ma dang mig mi bzang ngo zhes pa nye ba'i tshando ha dag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //🔽tshando ha dag la longs spyod pa ste 'khor ba ni g-yon skor gyis so //
analyzed: me'i rtsibs la hi ma la yar mdo mar bar du mkha' 'gro gdong ma dang mig mi bzang ngo zhes pa nye ba'i tshando ha dag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o // tshando ha dag la longs spyod pa ste 'khor ba ni g-yon skor gyis so //
translated: On the spoke of the south, in Pretapurī, in the forehead, is Pukkasī. On the spoke of the southeast, in Mālava, in the right eye, is Savarī. On the spoke of the east, in Triśakuni, in the right ear, is Caṇḍikā. On the spoke of the northeast, in Kāmarūpa, in the left ear, is Śavarī. On the spoke of the north, in Oḍra, in the left eye, is Ghasmarī. On the spoke of the northwest, in Kulatā, in the forehead, is Savarī. On the spoke of the west, in Rāmeśvara, in the throat, is Caṇḍikā. On the spoke of the southwest, in Pretapurī, in the heart, is Śavarī.

original: de ltar zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang tshando ha dang nye ba'i tshando ha longs spyod pa sa la spyod pa dag la gsung gi 'khor lor sngags pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang tshando ha dang nye ba'i tshando ha longs spyod pa sa la spyod pa dag la gsung gi 'khor lor sngags pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: On the spoke of the south, in Mālava, in the navel, is Ghasmarī. On the spoke of the southeast, in Triśakuni, in the right knee, is Caṇḍālī. On the spoke of the east, in Oḍra, in the right ankle, is Pukkasī. On the spoke of the northeast, in Kāmarūpa, in the left ankle, is Rūpiṇī. On the spoke of the north, in Kulatā, in the left knee, is

original: de nas sa'i steng dang sa'i 'og rgya mtsho'i khor yug la ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad po rnams su sku'i 'khor lor shar gyi rtsibs la pre ta p'u ri dang rtags la 'khor lo'i shugs can ma dang stobs po che'o //
analyzed: de nas sa'i steng dang sa'i 'og rgya mtsho'i khor yug la ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad po rnams su sku'i 'khor lor shar gyi rtsibs la pre ta p'u ri dang rtags la 'khor lo'i shugs can ma dang stobs po che'o //
translated: Then, on the earth and in the ocean surrounding the earth, in the eight directions of Meru, in the wheel of body, on the eastern spoke, in Pretāpura, in the sign, Cakravegā, and Mahābala.

original: lho'i rtsibs la gri ha de ba tar bshang lam du dum skyes ma dang rin chen rdo rje'o zhes pa 'du ba dag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag la longs spyod do //
analyzed: lho'i rtsibs la gri ha de ba tar bshang lam du dum skyes ma dang rin chen rdo rje'o zhes pa 'du ba dag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag la longs spyod do //
translated: On the southern spoke, in Grhadevata, in the anus, Khaṇḍarohā, and Ratnavajra. Thus, in the assemblies, the heroes enjoy the heroines.

original: nub kyi rtsibs la soo r'ashtar brla zung la shoondi ni dang rta mgrin no //
analyzed: nub kyi rtsibs la soo r'ashtar brla zung la shoondi ni dang rta mgrin no //
translated: On the western spoke, in Saurāṣṭra, in the pair of thighs, Śauṇḍinī and Hayagrīva.

original: byang gi rtsibs la gser gling du byin pa dag la 'khor lo'i go cha ma @94b dang nam mkha'i snying po'o zhes pa nye ba'i 'du ba dag la dpa' bo dang dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byang gi rtsibs la gser gling du byin pa dag la 'khor lo'i go cha ma @94b dang nam mkha'i snying po'o zhes pa nye ba'i 'du ba dag la dpa' bo dang dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //
translated: On the northern spoke, in Suvarṇadvīpa, in the gifts, Cakravarmiṇī and Ākāśagarbha. Thus, in the minor assemblies, the heroes and the heroines enjoy.

original: de ltar 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba dag la longs spyod pa ste 'khor ba ni g-yas skor gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba dag la longs spyod pa ste 'khor ba ni g-yas skor gyis so //
translated: Thus, he enjoys the assemblies and the neighboring assemblies, that is, cyclic existence, in a clockwise direction.

original: de nas dbang ldan gyi rtsibs la na ga rar rkang pa'i sor mo rnams la shin tu dpa' mo dang he ru ka'o //
analyzed: de nas dbang ldan gyi rtsibs la na ga rar rkang pa'i sor mo rnams la shin tu dpa' mo dang he ru ka'o //
translated: Then, on the spoke of Indra, in Nagara, on the toes of the feet are Pravadi and Heruka.

original: rlung gi rtsibs la sindhur rkang pa'i rgyab dag la stobs chen ma dang padma gar gyi dbang phyug go zhes pa dur khrod dag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //🔽bden bral gyi rtsibs la ma rung rkang pa'i mthe bong dag la 'khor los sgyur ma dang rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: rlung gi rtsibs la sindhur rkang pa'i rgyab dag la stobs chen ma dang padma gar gyi dbang phyug go zhes pa dur khrod dag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o // bden bral gyi rtsibs la ma rung rkang pa'i mthe bong dag la 'khor los sgyur ma dang rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: On the spoke of wind, in Sindhu, on the backs of the feet are Mahabala and Padmanarteshvara. Thus, he enjoys the heroes and heroines together with the heroes in the charnel grounds.🔽On the spoke of scorpions, in Maru, on the big toes of the feet are Cakravarmi and Vairochana.

original: me'i rtsibs la ku lu tar pus mo gnyis la brtson 'grus chen mo dang rdo rje sems dpa'o zhes pa nye ba'i dur khrod gag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: me'i rtsibs la ku lu tar pus mo gnyis la brtson 'grus chen mo dang rdo rje sems dpa'o zhes pa nye ba'i dur khrod gag la dpa' bo dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ma dag longs spyod pa'o //
translated: On the spoke of fire, in Kuluta, on the two knees are Mahaprajna and Vajrasattva. Thus, he enjoys the heroines together with the heroes in the neighboring charnel grounds.

original: de ltar dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod dag la longs spyod pa ste 'khor ba ni g-yon skor gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod dag la longs spyod pa ste 'khor ba ni g-yon skor gyis so //
translated: Thus, one should enjoy the charnel grounds and the neighboring charnel grounds, the leftward direction of cyclic existence.

original: de ltar 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba dang dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod la longs spyod pa sku'i 'khor lo mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba dang dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod la longs spyod pa sku'i 'khor lo mchod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should worship the wheel of the body by enjoying the assemblies and the neighboring assemblies, the charnel grounds and the neighboring charnel grounds.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa'i rim pas 'khor lo 'dus pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas bya'o zhes pa 'khor lo gsum gyi kun du spyod pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa'i rim pas 'khor lo 'dus pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas bya'o zhes pa 'khor lo gsum gyi kun du spyod pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: One should perform the wheel-assembly by means of the process of the yoginis' conduct, by means of the process that will be explained. This is the procedure of the conduct of the three wheels.

original: de nas sa 'og tu me dang rlung gi khor yug gi dbus su ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad po rnams su mi bzad pa'i du ba'i dmyal ba chen por dur khrod chen po brgyad po rnams su ste /🔽de la shar gyi dur khrod du mdung gis 'bigs par kha'i sgor khva gdong ma'o //
analyzed: de nas sa 'og tu me dang rlung gi khor yug gi dbus su ri rab kyi phyogs brgyad po rnams su mi bzad pa'i du ba'i dmyal ba chen por dur khrod chen po brgyad po rnams su ste / de la shar gyi dur khrod du mdung gis 'bigs par kha'i sgor khva gdong ma'o //
translated: Then, below the earth, in the middle of the circumferences of fire and wind, in the eight directions of Mt. Meru, in the eight great charnel grounds of the great Avici hells,🔽therein, in the eastern charnel ground, in the mouth of the spear, is Kākāsyā.

original: lhor ro bsregs par sna bug g-yas par 'ug gdong ma'o //
analyzed: lhor ro bsregs par sna bug g-yas par 'ug gdong ma'o //
translated: In the southern charnel ground, in the cremation ground, in the right nostril, is Ulūkāsyā.

original: nub tu rul pa'i drir bshang lam du khyi gdong ma'o //
analyzed: nub tu rul pa'i drir bshang lam du khyi gdong ma'o //
translated: In the west, in the smell of rottenness, in the anus, is Kshitigati.

original: byang du rnag gi drir sna bug g-yon pa'i sgor phag gdong ma'o zhes pa 'khor ba ni g-yas skor gyis so //
analyzed: byang du rnag gi drir sna bug g-yon pa'i sgor phag gdong ma'o zhes pa 'khor ba ni g-yas skor gyis so //
translated: In the north, in the smell of pus, in the left nostril, is Vyaghri.

original: de nas dbang ldan du byis pa shi bar rna ba g-yon pa'i sgor gshin rje brtan ma'o //🔽rlung du sprul gyis zos par rna ba g-yas pa'i sgor gshin rje pho nya ma'o //
analyzed: de nas dbang ldan du byis pa shi bar rna ba g-yon pa'i sgor gshin rje brtan ma'o // rlung du sprul gyis zos par rna ba g-yas pa'i sgor gshin rje pho nya ma'o //
translated: Then, in the northeast, in the death of a child, in the left ear, is Yamadhatri.🔽In the east wind, in the death by snake, in the right ear, is Yamadhuti.

original: bden bral du drag po'i g-yul du mig g-yas pa'i sgo ru gshin rje mche ba ma'o //
analyzed: bden bral du drag po'i g-yul du mig g-yas pa'i sgo ru gshin rje mche ba ma'o //
translated: In the southeast, in the death in a battle, in the right eye, is Yamadamstri.

original: me ru lhag ma za bar mig g-yon pa'i sgor gshin rje 'joms ma'o zhes pa 'khor @95a * //🔽ba ni g-yon skor gyis so //
analyzed: me ru lhag ma za bar mig g-yon pa'i sgor gshin rje 'joms ma'o zhes pa 'khor @95a * // ba ni g-yon skor gyis so //
translated: In the south fire, in the death by poison, in the left eye, is Yamamathani.🔽Thus, in the left ear, in the left nostril, in the left eye, and in the left ear, the order is reversed.

original: de ltar g-yas skor dang g-yon skor gyis lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs las bzlog pa dur khrod chen po brgyad longs spyod pa 'khor lo 'dus pa la mchod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar g-yas skor dang g-yon skor gyis lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs las bzlog pa dur khrod chen po brgyad longs spyod pa 'khor lo 'dus pa la mchod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the order of the right and the order of the left, one should worship the wheel-gathering, the enjoyment of the eight great charnel grounds.

original: de ltar lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba rnams dang ye shes dang thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo rnams dang kha la sogs pa sgo brgyad po rnams su sgo skyong ba rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba rnams dang ye shes dang thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo rnams dang kha la sogs pa sgo brgyad po rnams su sgo skyong ba rnams so //
translated: Thus, in the navel, heart, throat, and head cakras, and in the wisdom, mind, speech, and body cakras, and in the eight doors such as the mouth, the door guardians are located.

original: de ltar phyi rol dang nang du rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug ste 'di rnams kyi gnas bstan pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol dang nang du rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa drug ste 'di rnams kyi gnas bstan pa'o /
translated: Thus, there are thirty-six yoginīs externally and internally. This is the teaching on their locations.

original: // / da ni rigs ldan ma la sogs pa rnams kyis longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa dang bdag po nyid rnams brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni rigs ldan ma la sogs pa rnams kyis longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed pa dang bdag po nyid rnams brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the enjoyment, dissolution, control, and ownership of the kṣetrapas and so on will be described.

original: 'dir rigs ldan ma ni bdag gi gdan la sogs pa la thams cad du longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rigs ldan ma ni bdag gi gdan la sogs pa la thams cad du longs spyod pa dang thim pa dang dbang byed par shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the kṣetrapas should be understood as enjoying, dissolving, and controlling everything in one’s seat and so on.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams kyi rim pa ji lta bas bdag gi gdan la sogs pa la longs spyod pa la sogs pa ste 'dir bdag gi gdan du longs spyod do //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams kyi rim pa ji lta bas bdag gi gdan la sogs pa la longs spyod pa la sogs pa ste 'dir bdag gi gdan du longs spyod do //
translated: The Vajra dakinis and so forth, in their respective order, enjoy my seat and so forth. Here, they enjoy my seat.

original: gzhan gyi gdan du thim mo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gdan du thim mo //
translated: They dissolve into the other's seat.

original: de kho na'i gdan du dbang byed do //
analyzed: de kho na'i gdan du dbang byed do //
translated: They control the seat of reality.

original: sngags kyi gdan du bdag po nyid do //
analyzed: sngags kyi gdan du bdag po nyid do //
translated: They are the masters of the mantra seat.

translated: In the union of the wheels, one should move clockwise in the wheel of wisdom, counterclockwise in the wheel of art, in the practice of the yoginis.

analyzed: r'a me shva rar bdag po nyid do zhes pa chu srin 'char ba dang chu srin gyi phyed dang / bum pa 'char ba dang bum pa'i phyed la snying gar thugs kyi 'khor lo la rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa ste 'khor ba ni g-yon skor gyis so //
translated: In Rāmeśvara I am the lord means that at the rising of Makara and half of Makara, and at the rising of the pitcher and half of the pitcher, there is the conduct of the yoginīs in the heart at the wheel of mind. Circling is in a counterclockwise direction.

original: phyi rol du 'khor lo 'dus pa la gnas dang nye ba'i gnas rnams dang / thugs kyi 'khor lo la rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'khor lo 'dus pa la gnas dang nye ba'i gnas rnams dang / thugs kyi 'khor lo la rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Externally, it is the gathering of the wheel in the abode and the neighboring abode, and the conduct of the yoginīs in the wheel of mind.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe k'a ma r'u par longs spyod pa de'i tshe ao ter thim mo ;
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe k'a ma r'u par longs spyod pa de'i tshe ao ter thim mo ;

analyzed: ao trer bdag po nyid do zhes pa zhing dang nye ba'i zhing longs spyod pa g-yas skor gyis 'khor ba ste /
translated: In Oḍra, he is the lord. Thus, he enjoys the fields and the neighboring fields in a clockwise cycle.

original: mgrin par gsung gi 'khor lo la phyi rol du 'khor lo 'dus pa na nya 'char ba dang nya'i phyed dang lug 'char ba dang lug gi phyed la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi kun tu spyod pa'o //

translated: In the throat, in the wheel of speech, when the wheel is assembled externally, in the rising of Mina and half of Mina, and in the rising of Mesa and half of Mesa, there is the conduct of the yoginīs.

translated: In the arising of the bull, in the half of the bull, in the arising of the coupling, in the half of the coupling, in the throat, in the wheel of speech, externally, when the wheel is assembled, the yoginīs enjoy the fields and the neighboring fields, the assemblies and the neighboring assemblies.

analyzed: rnams kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the conduct of the yoginīs.
