analyzed: de nas mi'i pags pa khru gang tsam gyis sder byas te tshogs kyi gtso bo la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having made a footrest of human skin one cubit in size, offer it to the principal of the ganacakra.

original: shar gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la rta'i pags pa'i sder dang ; lho'i rnal 'byor ma rnams la khyi'i pags pa'i sder dang / nub kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la glang po che'i pags pa'i sder dang / byang gi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ba lang gi pags pa'i sder dang /
analyzed: shar gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la rta'i pags pa'i sder dang ; lho'i rnal 'byor ma rnams la khyi'i pags pa'i sder dang / nub kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la glang po che'i pags pa'i sder dang / byang gi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ba lang gi pags pa'i sder dang /
translated: Offer the footrest of horse skin to the yoginis of the east, the footrest of dog skin to the yoginis of the south, the footrest of elephant skin to the yoginis of the west, and the footrest of cow skin to the yoginis of the north.

original: dbang ldan gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ma he'i pags pa'i sder dang / rlung gi rnal 'byor ma rnams la bong bu'i pags pa'i sder dang / bden bral gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ce sbyang gi pags pa'i sder dang / me'i rnal 'byor ma rnams la rnga mo'i pags pa'i sder dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ma he'i pags pa'i sder dang / rlung gi rnal 'byor ma rnams la bong bu'i pags pa'i sder dang / bden bral gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ce sbyang gi pags pa'i sder dang / me'i rnal 'byor ma rnams la rnga mo'i pags pa'i sder dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The yoginīs of the wind direction should be offered a plate made of the skin of a donkey, the yoginīs of the direction of Indra a plate made of the skin of an elephant, the yoginīs of the direction of Agni a plate made of the skin of a buffalo, and the yoginīs of the direction of Nairṛti a plate made of the skin of a hyena.

original: de nas btung ba'i don du rang gi rigs kyi ro'i thod pa dum bu gcig pa dang dum bu gnyis pa dang dum bu gsum pa'am ji ltar rnyed pa rnal 'byor ma rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas btung ba'i don du rang gi rigs kyi ro'i thod pa dum bu gcig pa dang dum bu gnyis pa dang dum bu gsum pa'am ji ltar rnyed pa rnal 'byor ma rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of drinking, the yoginīs should be offered skull-cups of their own family, either one-piece, two-piece, or three-piece, or whatever is available.

original: de nas bza' ba sder du dbul zhing btung ba padma'i snod du phul te /
analyzed: de nas bza' ba sder du dbul zhing btung ba padma'i snod du phul te /
translated: Then, having offered food on a plate and drink in a lotus vessel,

original: sgrub pa pos bskor ba gsum byas la dri dang bdug pa dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod nas gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa pos bskor ba gsum byas la dri dang bdug pa dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod nas gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: the adept should circumambulate three times, make offerings of perfume, incense, flowers, and so forth, and make a request.

original: bsod nams 'di yis sems can thams cad phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes thob par gyur cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams 'di yis sems can thams cad phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes thob par gyur cig ces pa'o //
translated: By this merit, may all sentient beings attain the exalted wisdom of Mahamudra.

original: 'di la bu'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo ni rgyal pos bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la bu'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo ni rgyal pos bya ste /
translated: Here, the circle of sons is performed by the king.

original: thun mong ba nams kyis sngags kyi stobs sam lha'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ba nams kyis sngags kyi stobs sam lha'i nges pa'o //
translated: By the common [circle], [one should] recite the power of the mantra or the deity.

original: gzhan du na grub pa po rnams la bar chad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na grub pa po rnams la bar chad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, obstacles will arise for the adepts.

original: thun mong ba'i sogs kyi 'khor lo ni yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis bya'o /
analyzed: thun mong ba'i sogs kyi 'khor lo ni yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis bya'o /
translated: The common circle is performed by the conventions of country and caste.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du rang gi khyim du rigs kyi btsun mo yongs su smin pa dang lhan cig bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du rang gi khyim du rigs kyi btsun mo yongs su smin pa dang lhan cig bya'o //
translated: For the sake of the accumulation of merit, [one should] do it in one's own house together with the fully matured noble queen of the family.

original: gzhan du na sogs kyi 'khor lor mi 'gyur @116a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na sogs kyi 'khor lor mi 'gyur @116a * //
translated: Otherwise, it will not be the circle of the common [circle].

original: zhing shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde bas dman zhing byang chub kyi sems myang ba spangs pa'i bza' ba dang btung bas dpa' bo'i ston mor brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhing shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde bas dman zhing byang chub kyi sems myang ba spangs pa'i bza' ba dang btung bas dpa' bo'i ston mor brjod par bya'o //
translated: And it should be called the feast of the hero, with food and drink that are inferior due to the bliss of the union of wisdom and means, and devoid of the taste of the thought of awakening.

original: de nyid dge bsnyen rnams kyis slob dpon gtso bor bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid dge bsnyen rnams kyis slob dpon gtso bor bya'o //
translated: Those very [laymen] are to be the chief teachers for the lay vow-holders.

original: sngags kyi tshul la slob dpon yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul la slob dpon yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In the way of Mantra, the teacher is also of three kinds:

original: khyim gnas dge tshul dge slong ni //
analyzed: khyim gnas dge tshul dge slong ni //
translated: The householder, the novice monk, and the fully ordained monk,

original: dman pa 'bring dang mchog yin no //
analyzed: dman pa 'bring dang mchog yin no //
translated: are the inferior, the middling, and the best.

original: zhes pa'o // de nyid bcu yongs su shes pa dang dbang bskur ba dang rjes su gnang ba dang ldan pa yang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de nyid bcu yongs su shes pa dang dbang bskur ba dang rjes su gnang ba dang ldan pa yang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: And he who is endowed with the knowledge of the ten topics, the consecration, and the permission, is not the same as the other.

original: rgyud du gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung las so //
analyzed: rgyud du gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung las so //
translated: [The teacher] is so because of the speech of the Lord as it is taught in the tantras.

original: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul gnyis po de dag la bla mar gyur kyang chos 'chad pa'i dus su dge slong brtul zhugs 'dzin pa rnams kyis dam pa'i chos la sogs pa mdun du byas te phyag 'tshal bar bya'i //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul gnyis po de dag la bla mar gyur kyang chos 'chad pa'i dus su dge slong brtul zhugs 'dzin pa rnams kyis dam pa'i chos la sogs pa mdun du byas te phyag 'tshal bar bya'i //
translated: Even though those two, the householder and the novice monk, are the gurus, when they are teaching the Dharma, the fully ordained monks who are observing the vows should pay homage to the holy Dharma, etc.,

original: chos 'chad pa ma yin par gzhan gyi dus su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa ma yin par gzhan gyi dus su ni ma yin no //
translated: but not when they are not teaching the Dharma.

original: gzhan gyi dus na dam pa ma yin pa'i las dang phyag 'tshal ba spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dus na dam pa ma yin pa'i las dang phyag 'tshal ba spangs te /
translated: At other times, they should avoid non-holy actions and paying homage.

original: sngon du ldang ba dang gdan bstab pa la sogs pa bskur sti thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du ldang ba dang gdan bstab pa la sogs pa bskur sti thams cad bya'o //
translated: All the honors, such as rising up, offering a seat, etc., should be done first.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i las rkang pa bkru ba la sogs pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi phyag sbangs nas nor la sogs pas bkur bar bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i las rkang pa bkru ba la sogs pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi phyag sbangs nas nor la sogs pas bkur bar bya ste /
translated: Having bowed with body, speech, and mind, one should honor with wealth, etc., the non-noble actions such as washing the feet, etc.

original: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul dag la dge slong rnams kyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul dag la dge slong rnams kyis zhes pa'o //
translated: The monks should do this for the householders and novices.

original: sngar dge slong phyis rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang bskur te rdo rje 'dzin pa byas pa'i bla ma la ni dge slong rnams kyis dus thams cad du phyag bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: sngar dge slong phyis rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang bskur te rdo rje 'dzin pa byas pa'i bla ma la ni dge slong rnams kyis dus thams cad du phyag bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: It is certain that the monks should always bow to the guru who is a Vajra Holder, who was first a monk and later was initiated by a Vajra Master and became a Vajra Holder.

original: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul mngon par shes pa thob pa dag la dge slong dang mi'i bdag pos kyang phyag bya'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul mngon par shes pa thob pa dag la dge slong dang mi'i bdag pos kyang phyag bya'o //
translated: The monks and the lords of men should bow to the householders and novices who have attained the superknowledges.

original: de'i phyir khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul dang dge slong dbang bskur ba rnams la rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bkur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul dang dge slong dbang bskur ba rnams la rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bkur bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the lay practitioner, the novice, and the monk who have received higher ordination are to be honored according to their seniority.

original: 'dir khyim na gnas pa dag gis sngar dbang bskur ba ni rgan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir khyim na gnas pa dag gis sngar dbang bskur ba ni rgan pa'o //
translated: Here, the lay practitioner who has received higher ordination first is senior.

original: de bzhin du dge tshul dag gi nang du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge tshul dag gi nang du'o //
translated: In the same way, among the novices.

original: de bzhin du dge slong dag gi nang na sngar dbang bskur ba ni rgan pa ste sngar gyi gnas skabs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dag gi nang na sngar dbang bskur ba ni rgan pa ste sngar gyi gnas skabs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: In the same way, among the monks, the one who has received higher ordination first is senior, because of the priority of his status.

original: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i bu dbang bskur ba ni 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i bu dbang bskur ba ni 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, the son of a universal monarch who has received higher ordination becomes a universal monarch;

original: @116b rgyal po'i bu dbang bskur ba ni rgyal bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @116b rgyal po'i bu dbang bskur ba ni rgyal bor 'gyur ro //
translated: the son of a king who has received higher ordination becomes a king;

original: blon po'i bu dbang bskur ba ni blon por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blon po'i bu dbang bskur ba ni blon por 'gyur ro //
translated: the son of a minister who has received higher ordination becomes a minister.

original: de bzhin du dge slong dbang bskur ba ni slob dpon mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dbang bskur ba ni slob dpon mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the monk who has received higher ordination becomes the best master;

original: dge tshul ni slob dpon 'bring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge tshul ni slob dpon 'bring por 'gyur ro //
translated: the novice becomes a middling master;🔽the lay practitioner becomes an inferior master.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni slob dpon tha mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni slob dpon tha mar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who lives in a household is the least qualified master.

original: de'i phyir gsum po rnams las sngar dge slong phyis rdo rje 'dzin par byas pa ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang rab gnas la sogs pa la tshogs kyi 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum po rnams las sngar dge slong phyis rdo rje 'dzin par byas pa ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang rab gnas la sogs pa la tshogs kyi 'dren pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who is a monk first and later becomes a vajra holder is the leader of the gaṇa in the gaṇa cakra, consecration, and so forth.

original: de med na dge tshul te /
analyzed: de med na dge tshul te /
translated: If he is not available, then a novice monk.

original: de med na khyim na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de med na khyim na gnas pa'o //
translated: If he is not available, then one who lives in a household.

original: gang gi tsho slob dpon dge slong yod kyang sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi gtso bor mi byed na /
analyzed: gang gi tsho slob dpon dge slong yod kyang sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi gtso bor mi byed na /
translated: If a householder master is present, but the patron does not make him the chief of the gaṇa,

original: de'i tshe mchod bya dang mchod pa'i rim pa log pas sbyin pa'i bdag po rnams kyis bsod nams phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mchod bya dang mchod pa'i rim pa log pas sbyin pa'i bdag po rnams kyis bsod nams phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time the patron will have inverted merit because the object of worship and the order of worship are inverted.

original: dur smrig gi rtags sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dur smrig gi rtags sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is a householder who has not abandoned the ten nonvirtues.

original: de ltar yon tan thams cad ldan //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan thams cad ldan //
translated: Thus, he is endowed with all good qualities,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin //
translated: holds the victory banner of omniscience,

original: mi dge bcu po spangs pa ni //
analyzed: mi dge bcu po spangs pa ni //
translated: and has abandoned the ten nonvirtues.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i gtso bor bya //
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i gtso bor bya //
translated: He should be made the chief of the gaṇa cakra.

original: snying brtse med cing khro la gdug / khengs dang brkam chags ma bsdams pa //
analyzed: snying brtse med cing khro la gdug / khengs dang brkam chags ma bsdams pa //
translated: Without compassion, angry and cruel, arrogant, greedy, and unrestrained,

original: rang la bstod pa rtag tu ni //
analyzed: rang la bstod pa rtag tu ni //
translated: always praising oneself,

original: sangs rgyas bde 'dod pas mi bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bde 'dod pas mi bya //
translated: one who desires the bliss of buddhahood should not do so.

original: gang zhig khyim pa bsti gnas spyod //
analyzed: gang zhig khyim pa bsti gnas spyod //
translated: One who is a householder, a practitioner of the sacred sites,

original: gshol 'dzugs tshong pa gcam bu ba //
analyzed: gshol 'dzugs tshong pa gcam bu ba //
translated: one who sets up plows, trades, and is deceitful,

original: rmongs pa dam chos 'tshong ba ni //
analyzed: rmongs pa dam chos 'tshong ba ni //
translated: one who is deluded and sells the true Dharma,

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i gtso bor min //
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i gtso bor min //
translated: is not the chief of the gaṇacakra.

original: zhes pa'o // de ltar rdo rje slob dpon thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ltar rdo rje slob dpon thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa /
translated: Thus, the vajra master who holds the victory banner of omniscience,

original: dpa' bo'i ston mo la sbyin pa'i bdag pos shar du phyogs par gzhag par bya'o //🔽de'i g-yas kyi char rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i rim pas slob dpon dge slong gi gral shar du phyogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i ston mo la sbyin pa'i bdag pos shar du phyogs par gzhag par bya'o // de'i g-yas kyi char rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i rim pas slob dpon dge slong gi gral shar du phyogs par bya'o //
translated: the patron of the feast of heroes, should be placed facing east.🔽To his right, the row of elder and younger masters, bhikṣus, should be placed facing east.

original: de nas bden bral nas brtsams te me'i mthar thug par rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i dbye bas slob dpon dge tshul gyi gral byang du phyogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bden bral nas brtsams te me'i mthar thug par rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i dbye bas slob dpon dge tshul gyi gral byang du phyogs par bya'o //
translated: Then, from the southwest to the southeast, the row of elder and younger masters, śrāmaṇeras, should be placed facing north.

original: dbang ldan nas brtsams te rlung gi mthar thug bar rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i dbye bas slob dpon khyim pa'i gral lhor phyogs bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan nas brtsams te rlung gi mthar thug bar rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i dbye bas slob dpon khyim pa'i gral lhor phyogs bar bya'o //
translated: Beginning from the southeast and ending in the northwest, the row of master householders should be arranged according to seniority.

original: rlung nas brtsams te bden bral gyi mthar thug par slob dpon dge slong gi gral bya'o //🔽tshogs kyi bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i shar du bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa @117a * //
analyzed: rlung nas brtsams te bden bral gyi mthar thug par slob dpon dge slong gi gral bya'o // tshogs kyi bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i shar du bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa @117a * //
translated: Beginning from the northeast and ending in the southwest, the row of master monks should be arranged.

original: gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the east, food and drink, etc. should be placed under the control of Gaṇapati.

original: dbus su rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor med na /
analyzed: dbus su rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor med na /
translated: In the center, if there is no maṇḍala of colored powder,

original: ba byung gi mandala gru bzhi pa byas te der dri dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod par bya zhing tshogs kyi bdag po'i g-yon du las kyi phyag rgya gcig bzhag nas tshogs kyi bdag po'i phyag rgya bya'o //
analyzed: ba byung gi mandala gru bzhi pa byas te der dri dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod par bya zhing tshogs kyi bdag po'i g-yon du las kyi phyag rgya gcig bzhag nas tshogs kyi bdag po'i phyag rgya bya'o //
translated: one should make a square maṇḍala of cow dung, and there one should make offerings with scent, flowers, etc. Having placed one karmamudrā to the left of Gaṇapati, one should make the mudrā of Gaṇapati.

original: rnam pa gzhan du rnal 'byor ma dang bral ba ni tshogs kyi bdag po'i btung bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du rnal 'byor ma dang bral ba ni tshogs kyi bdag po'i btung bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Otherwise, without a yoginī, one will not be a drinker of the gaṇa’s drink.

original: dpa' bo'i longs spyod la yang gdon mi za bar sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi bdag po la bsod nams 'phel ba'i don du phyag rgya dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo'i longs spyod la yang gdon mi za bar sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi bdag po la bsod nams 'phel ba'i don du phyag rgya dbul bar bya'o //
translated: In the feast of the hero, the patron should certainly offer the consort to the lord of the feast for the sake of increasing merit.

original: gal te gong du dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dbang du rgan po dang rmongs pa dang gzhon pa ston pa por gyur pa der gzhon pa tshogs kyi bdag po ste /
analyzed: gal te gong du dge slong rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dbang du rgan po dang rmongs pa dang gzhon pa ston pa por gyur pa der gzhon pa tshogs kyi bdag po ste /
translated: If the elder, the fool, or the youth is the teacher, then the youth is the lord of the feast.

original: rgan po rmongs pa ni khyim gzhan du tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan po rmongs pa ni khyim gzhan du tshim par bya'o //
translated: The elder and the fool should be satisfied in another house.

original: de bzhin du rgyud gzhan dang gzhan du dbang bskur ba'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang dpa' bo'i ston mo la khyim so sor mchod par bya'o //🔽sngar dge slong ma dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i dbye bas shar du mngon par phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud gzhan dang gzhan du dbang bskur ba'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyang dpa' bo'i ston mo la khyim so sor mchod par bya'o // sngar dge slong ma dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i dbye bas shar du mngon par phyogs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the yoginīs who have been initiated in other tantras should be worshipped in their own houses at the feast of the hero.🔽The nuns who have previously received initiation should be in the east, according to their seniority.

original: dge tshul ma dbang bskur ba rnams byang du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge tshul ma dbang bskur ba rnams byang du phyogs pa'o //
translated: The probationer nuns should be in the north.

original: dge bsnyen ma dbang bskur ba rnams lhor mngon par phyogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma dbang bskur ba rnams lhor mngon par phyogs par bya'o //
translated: The lay vow-holders should be placed to the south, facing north.

original: tshogs kyi bdag po'i g-yon du sbyin pa'i bdag pos thabs gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi bdag po'i g-yon du sbyin pa'i bdag pos thabs gzhag par bya'o //
translated: To the left of the lord of the ganacakra, the patron should be placed.

original: rnam pa gzhan du thabs dang bral ba'i tshogs kyi bdag mos sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du thabs dang bral ba'i tshogs kyi bdag mos sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, the lord of the ganacakra, without a patron, should not eat the flesh.

original: de nas dpa' mo'i ston mo la gdon mi za bar sbyin pa'i bdag pos thabs dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dpa' mo'i ston mo la gdon mi za bar sbyin pa'i bdag pos thabs dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in the feast of the heroines, the patron should certainly offer the method.

original: lhag ma dkyil 'khor la sogs pa snga ma bzhin dbus su ste bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa shar du'o //🔽de nas tshogs kyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i g-yon skor gyis bza' ba ston mo dbul zhing btung ba ni kham phor ram /
analyzed: lhag ma dkyil 'khor la sogs pa snga ma bzhin dbus su ste bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa shar du'o // de nas tshogs kyi gtso bo la sogs pa'i g-yon skor gyis bza' ba ston mo dbul zhing btung ba ni kham phor ram /
translated: The remainder, such as the maṇḍala, and so on, are as before. The food and drink, and so on, are in the east.

original: n'a ri ke la la sogs pa'i snod du dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: n'a ri ke la la sogs pa'i snod du dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, beginning with the principal one of the gaṇacakra, the food of the feast is offered in a counterclockwise direction. The drink is offered in a cup or a vessel such as a nārīkela.

original: de'i phyir chang la sogs pa spyad par bya ba dang rtogs par bya ba dang sbar bar bya bas bdud rtsir bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chang la sogs pa spyad par bya ba dang rtogs par bya ba dang sbar bar bya bas bdud rtsir bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should make the beer, and so on, into nectar by using, understanding, and burning.

original: gtor ma la sogs pa phul nas sngar bshad pa'i ril bus bsang gtor byas la /
analyzed: gtor ma la sogs pa phul nas sngar bshad pa'i ril bus bsang gtor byas la /
translated: Having offered the sacrificial cake and so forth, one should fumigate with the previously explained pill.

original: de nas lag pa g-yon pa dang aom yig gis sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lag pa g-yon pa dang aom yig gis sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with the left hand and the syllable Om, one should purify.

original: lag pa g-yas pa dang a'a: yig gis rtogs @117b par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa dang a'a: yig gis rtogs @117b par bya'o //
translated: With the right hand and the syllable Ah, one should realize.

original: gnyis kas bkab ste h'um yig gis spar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kas bkab ste h'um yig gis spar bar bya'o //
translated: With both hands covering, one should inflame with the syllable Hum.

original: mkha' lding gi phyag rgya dang ho: yig gis bdud rtsir bya ste /
analyzed: mkha' lding gi phyag rgya dang ho: yig gis bdud rtsir bya ste /
translated: With the mudra of the garuda and the syllable Ho, one should make nectar.

original: chang gi thigs pas g-yon pa'i ming med kyi rtse mos sa la chos 'byung gru gsum byas nas /
analyzed: chang gi thigs pas g-yon pa'i ming med kyi rtse mos sa la chos 'byung gru gsum byas nas /
translated: With a drop of beer, with the tip of the left ring finger, one should make a triangular source of phenomena on the ground.

original: de'i dbus su thig le ltar zlum por bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su thig le ltar zlum por bskor bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, one should circle like a drop.

original: de'i dbus su ye shes gyi  'khor lo lta sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid dangs shing gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa de 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su ye shes gyi  'khor lo lta sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid dangs shing gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa de 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas tshim par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, one should satisfy the wisdom wheel, which has the nature of thirty-seven deities, clear and like a reflection, with the rite that will be explained.

original: zhing skyong la sogs pa rnams kyi grong khyer dang grong gi ming gi yi ge mnyam pa rnams mnyam pa'i ming gis yi ge dang po dang / ming gi yi ge gsum pa rnams mi mnyam pa'i yi ge ste dang po dang bar dang mtha'i yi ge rnams kyis ming du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhing skyong la sogs pa rnams kyi grong khyer dang grong gi ming gi yi ge mnyam pa rnams mnyam pa'i ming gis yi ge dang po dang / ming gi yi ge gsum pa rnams mi mnyam pa'i yi ge ste dang po dang bar dang mtha'i yi ge rnams kyis ming du 'gyur ro //
translated: The names of the cities and towns of the field protectors and so forth are equal names of the equal letters, and the first letters and the third letters of the names are the unequal letters, that is, the first, middle, and last letters become the name.

original: dang po aom yig dang dbus su ming dang mthar a'a: h'um che ge mo ba lim grihna grihna sarbba sa tv'a n'am sh'antim tsittam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: dang po aom yig dang dbus su ming dang mthar a'a: h'um che ge mo ba lim grihna grihna sarbba sa tv'a n'am sh'antim tsittam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: At the beginning, the syllable OM, in the middle, the name, at the end, the syllable A: HUM, Please accept the bali offering of so-and-so, and make the mind of all beings peaceful, make it peaceful, SVĀHĀ.

original: de bzhin du aom ha ri t'i pandi ke pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de bzhin du aom ha ri t'i pandi ke pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: Similarly, OM HARITĪ PĀṆḌIKĀ PRATĪCCHĀ SVĀHĀ.

original: 'phrog ma'i chang bu'i sngags so //
analyzed: 'phrog ma'i chang bu'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra of Hārītī's liquor.

original: aom d'u ti k'i aa gra gr'a sam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom d'u ti k'i aa gra gr'a sam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: OM DŪTIKĀ AGRA GRĀSA PRATĪCCHĀ SVĀHĀ.

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis mngon par bsngags nas bza' ba'i mthar ji srid par sa la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis mngon par bsngags nas bza' ba'i mthar ji srid par sa la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having enchanted with the mantra of OM A: HUM, one should place it on the ground until the end of the meal.

original: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi au tstshishta ba li bhaksha bhaksha ka sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi au tstshishta ba li bhaksha bhaksha ka sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ kha kha khāhi khāhi ucchiṣṭavali bhakṣa bhakṣaka svāhā.

original: lhag ma'i gtor ma'i sngags so //
analyzed: lhag ma'i gtor ma'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra for the leftovers offering.

original: ji ltar skabs su bab pa'i dus na thams cad re re zhing bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar skabs su bab pa'i dus na thams cad re re zhing bya'o //
translated: At the appropriate times, one should do each of these.

original: de nas slob dpon slob ma dang bcas pa thams cad kyis bza' ba dang btung ba bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon slob ma dang bcas pa thams cad kyis bza' ba dang btung ba bya'o //
translated: Then the master and all the disciples should eat and drink.

original: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig 'thab pa dang rtsod pa byed pa de bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig 'thab pa dang rtsod pa byed pa de bskrad par bya'o //
translated: If someone should fight or argue, he should be expelled.

original: de bzhin du dge tshul dang khyim pa nga rgyal byed na de'i tshe nus pa dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge tshul dang khyim pa nga rgyal byed na de'i tshe nus pa dri bar bya'o //
translated: If a novice or a householder should act arrogantly, then his ability should be tested.

original: gal te mngon par shes pa lnga la sogs pa'i nus pa ston par byed na /
analyzed: gal te mngon par shes pa lnga la sogs pa'i nus pa ston par byed na /
translated: If he demonstrates the ability to display the five superknowledges and so forth,

original: de'i tshe de thams cad kyis thams cad du tshogs kyi gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de thams cad kyis thams cad du tshogs kyi gtso bo'o //
translated: then he is the chief of the gaṇa in every way.

original: rnam pa gzhan du thos pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang dbang bskur bas rgan pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis dge tshul dang khyim na gnas pa tshogs kyi gtso bor mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du thos pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang dbang bskur bas rgan pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis dge tshul dang khyim na gnas pa tshogs kyi gtso bor mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, through the pride of the higher ordination of learning, and through the pride of the higher ordination of consecration, the novice monk and the householder will not become the chief of the assembly.

original: gang zhig sngar dge slong yin pa de thams cad du tshogs kyi gtso bo'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sngar dge slong yin pa de thams cad du tshogs kyi gtso bo'o //
translated: Whoever is a monk first is the chief of the assembly in all cases.

original: gal te dpa' bo'i ston mo la bskrad pa de chad pa 'bul na /🔽de'i tshe bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i @118a * //
analyzed: gal te dpa' bo'i ston mo la bskrad pa de chad pa 'bul na / de'i tshe bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i @118a * //
translated: If one who has been expelled from the hero’s feast offers a fine,

original: chad pa sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: chad pa sbyin par bya ste /
translated: then at that time he should give a fine of food and drink, etc.

original: de ni tshogs kyi bdag pos so //
analyzed: de ni tshogs kyi bdag pos so //
translated: That is done by the master of the assembly.

original: de ltar sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang dpa' bo'i ston mo la thams cad du slob dpon gyis bsgrub par bya'o /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang dpa' bo'i ston mo la thams cad du slob dpon gyis bsgrub par bya'o /
translated: Thus, the master should always accomplish the wheel of the assembly and the hero’s feast for the benefactor.

original: // / da ni sngags bsgrub pa'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sngags bsgrub pa'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the procedure for accomplishing the mantra should be stated.

original: 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pas dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa dang sngags bsgrub pa'i gnas bstan pa gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad pas dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa dang sngags bsgrub pa'i gnas bstan pa gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the verses to be explained teach the site for the construction of the maṇḍala and the accomplishment of mantra:🔽On a mountain, in a thicket, in a ravine,

original: ri bo tshang tshing ri sul dang // rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram dang ni //
analyzed: ri bo tshang tshing ri sul dang // rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram dang ni //
translated: on the shore of the great ocean,

original: gdod nas grub pa'i dur khrod du //
analyzed: gdod nas grub pa'i dur khrod du //
translated: and in a primordial charnel ground,

original: der ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
analyzed: der ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
translated: there one should draw the maṇḍala.

original: zhes pa las rab 'byam 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //🔽de la gsungs pa'i gnas su 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas ri bo'i steng du rengs pa dang rmongs pa dang phur bus btab pa bsgrub bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa las rab 'byam 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so // de la gsungs pa'i gnas su 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas ri bo'i steng du rengs pa dang rmongs pa dang phur bus btab pa bsgrub bar bya'o //
translated: This was taught by the Bhagavān for the sake of accomplishing the mundane siddhis of the extensive tantra.🔽Having constructed the maṇḍala in the site that was taught, one should accomplish petrifying, stupefying, and stabbing on a mountain top.

original: tshang tshing shing ljon pa rgyas par dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas dbang dang dgug pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshang tshing shing ljon pa rgyas par dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas dbang dang dgug pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Having constructed the maṇḍala in a thicket of flourishing trees, one should accomplish enthralling and summoning.

original: ri sul chu dang 'bab chu'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas zhi ba dang rgyas pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ri sul chu dang 'bab chu'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas zhi ba dang rgyas pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In a mountain ravine or on the bank of a river or a waterfall, one should perform the rites of pacification and prosperity, having erected the maṇḍala.

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas dbye ba dang bskrad pa dang bsad pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas dbye ba dang bskrad pa dang bsad pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: On the shore of the great ocean, one should perform the rites of separation, expulsion, and killing, having erected the maṇḍala.

original: gdod nas grub pa'i dur khrod du dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags btu ba bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gdod nas grub pa'i dur khrod du dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags btu ba bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In a charnel ground that is naturally established, one should perform the rite of collecting the mantras of the ḍākinīs, having erected the maṇḍala.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub rnams te 'dir ri bor gter gyi dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub rnams te 'dir ri bor gter gyi dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should perform the worldly accomplishments here, such as the accomplishment of a treasure in a mountain.

original: tshang tshing du rin po che'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshang tshing du rin po che'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In a thicket, one should perform the accomplishment of jewels.

original: ri sul du ro bcud kyi dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ri sul du ro bcud kyi dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In a mountain ravine, one should perform the accomplishment of the elixir of life.

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du ral gri'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du ral gri'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: On the shore of the great ocean, one should perform the accomplishment of the sword.

original: dur khrod du mig sman gyi dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dur khrod du mig sman gyi dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In a charnel ground, one should perform the accomplishment of the eye medicine.

original: gzhan yang gnas de rnams su gsungs pa'i cho gas gsang sngags bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gnas de rnams su gsungs pa'i cho gas gsang sngags bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should accomplish the mantra by the rite taught in those places.

original: 'dir dang por re zhig dur khrod du dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas mchod pa chen po bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dang por re zhig dur khrod du dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas mchod pa chen po bya ste /
translated: Here, first of all, having erected the maṇḍala in a charnel ground, one should perform the great worship.

original: lo dang po'i nag pa'i nya la rtsa ba'i sngags kyis mchod yon phul nas /
analyzed: lo dang po'i nag pa'i nya la rtsa ba'i sngags kyis mchod yon phul nas /
translated: On the new moon of the first month, having offered water for the feet with the root mantra,

original: mi'i so'i bgrang phreng gis rtsa ba'i sngags zla ba so so la 'bum phrag gsum @118b bzlas par bya zhing /
analyzed: mi'i so'i bgrang phreng gis rtsa ba'i sngags zla ba so so la 'bum phrag gsum @118b bzlas par bya zhing /
translated: one should recite the root mantra three hundred thousand times each month with a rosary of human bone.

original: lnga pa la sogs pa rdzogs pa so so la las rab 'byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyi bcu chas sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: lnga pa la sogs pa rdzogs pa so so la las rab 'byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyi bcu chas sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: On the fifth and so forth, at the completion of each month, one should perform a burnt offering with the substances taught in the Compendium of Activities, using a tenth part.

original: de ltar lo gcig gis 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa drug bzlas par bya zhing /
analyzed: de ltar lo gcig gis 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa drug bzlas par bya zhing /
translated: In that way, one should recite thirty-six hundred thousand times in one year.

original: sbyin sreg khri phrag sum cu rtsa drug bya'o //🔽aom shr'i badzra he he ru ru kam hum h'um phat /
analyzed: sbyin sreg khri phrag sum cu rtsa drug bya'o // aom shr'i badzra he he ru ru kam hum h'um phat /
translated: One should perform thirty-six hundred thousand burnt offerings.🔽Oṃ śrī vajra he he ru ru ka huṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: d'a ki ni dz'a la sam ba ra sv'a h'a /
analyzed: d'a ki ni dz'a la sam ba ra sv'a h'a /
translated: Ḍākinī jvalasambhara svāhā.

original: zhes pa rtsa ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: zhes pa rtsa ba'i sngags so //
translated: This is the root mantra.

original: de nas lo gnyis pa la cho ga de nyid kyis snying po'i sngags lo gcig gi bar du bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: de nas lo gnyis pa la cho ga de nyid kyis snying po'i sngags lo gcig gi bar du bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Then, in the second year, one should recite the essence mantra and perform the burnt offering for one year with just that rite.

original: aom hram hrim hrem h'um phat ces pa snying po'i sngags yi ge drug pa'o //
analyzed: aom hram hrim hrem h'um phat ces pa snying po'i sngags yi ge drug pa'o //
translated: The essence mantra is Om hrīḥ hriṃ hreṃ hūṃ phaṭ, the six-syllable mantra.

original: slar yang cho ga de nyid kyis lo gsum pa la nye ba'i snying po bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: slar yang cho ga de nyid kyis lo gsum pa la nye ba'i snying po bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Again, in the third year, one should recite the near essence and perform the burnt offering with just that rite.

original: aom hr'i: ha ha hum h'um phat ces pa nye ba'i snying po'i sngags yi ge bdun pa'o //
analyzed: aom hr'i: ha ha hum h'um phat ces pa nye ba'i snying po'i sngags yi ge bdun pa'o //
translated: The near essence mantra is Om hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ, the seven-syllable mantra.

original: de nas lo bzhi pa la cho ga de nyid kyis go cha'i sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: de nas lo bzhi pa la cho ga de nyid kyis go cha'i sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Then, in the fourth year, one should recite the armor mantra and perform the burnt offering with just that rite.

original: aom hrlim hrim hrim hra: hum h'um phat ces pa go cha'i sngags yi ge brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: aom hrlim hrim hrim hra: hum h'um phat ces pa go cha'i sngags yi ge brgyad pa'o //
translated: The armor mantra is Om hrīṃ hrīṃ hrīṃ hrīḥ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ, the eight-syllable mantra.

original: de nas lo lnga pa la cho ga de nyid kyis rdo rje phag mo'i snying po'i sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: de nas lo lnga pa la cho ga de nyid kyis rdo rje phag mo'i snying po'i sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Then, in the fifth year, one should recite Vajravārāhī's essence mantra and perform the burnt offering with just that rite.🔽 The essence mantra is Om hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ, the seven-syllable mantra.

original: aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye hum h'um phat ces pa snying po'i sngags yi ge bcu pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye hum h'um phat ces pa snying po'i sngags yi ge bcu pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The essence mantra is Om Vajravarahi Hri Hri Hum Hum Phat, which is ten syllables, the purification of the ten perfections.

original: de nas lo drug pa la cho ga de nyid kyis lha mo'i go cha'i sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: de nas lo drug pa la cho ga de nyid kyis lha mo'i go cha'i sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Then, in the sixth year, one should recite the armor mantra of the goddess and perform the burnt offering with that very rite.

original: aom bom yom mom hrem hr'im hum h'um phat ces pa go cha chen mo'i sngags yi ge brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: aom bom yom mom hrem hr'im hum h'um phat ces pa go cha chen mo'i sngags yi ge brgyad pa'o //
translated: The armor mantra is Om Bom Yom Mom Hrem Hrim Hum Hum Phat, which is eight syllables.

original: de ltar lo drug po rnams kyis sngags drug po rnams bye ba phrag gnyis dang 'bum phrag bcu drug bzlas shing /
analyzed: de ltar lo drug po rnams kyis sngags drug po rnams bye ba phrag gnyis dang 'bum phrag bcu drug bzlas shing /
translated: Thus, in the six years, one recites the six mantras two million and one hundred and sixty thousand times.

original: sbyin sreg 'bum phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang khri phrag drug bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin sreg 'bum phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang khri phrag drug bya ste /
translated: And one performs the burnt offering twenty-one hundred thousand and sixty thousand times.

original: des rnal 'byor pa'i lus dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rnal 'byor pa'i lus dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the yogin's body becomes pure.

original: da ni zhal bzhi pa rnam par dag pa'i don du zhal bzhi pa'i sngags kyi bzlas pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni zhal bzhi pa rnam par dag pa'i don du zhal bzhi pa'i sngags kyi bzlas pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, for the sake of the purification of the four faces, the recitation of the mantra of the four-faced one will be explained.

original: 'dir chu srin gyi 'pho ba la rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te mkha' 'gro ma la mchod yon phul nas /
analyzed: 'dir chu srin gyi 'pho ba la rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te mkha' 'gro ma la mchod yon phul nas /
translated: Here, in the Makara lunar mansion, one should erect a maṇḍala on the shore of the great ocean, and offer a libation to the ḍākinīs.

original: zla ba so so la shar gyi zhal gyi sngags mkha' 'gro ma'i ming dang lhan cig pa hum h'um phat kye mtha' can 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pa bya zhing rdzogs pa so so la bcu cha'i sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: zla ba so so la shar gyi zhal gyi sngags mkha' 'gro ma'i ming dang lhan cig pa hum h'um phat kye mtha' can 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pa bya zhing rdzogs pa so so la bcu cha'i sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: One should recite the mantra of the eastern face together with the name of the ḍākinī, “Oṃ oṃ phaṭ kṣe” three hundred thousand times, and at the end of each month one should perform a tenth-part burnt offering.

original: aom sumbha ni sumbha badzra d'a ki n'i hum h'um phat ces pa shar gyi zhal gyi sngags yi @119a / ge bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: aom sumbha ni sumbha badzra d'a ki n'i hum h'um phat ces pa shar gyi zhal gyi sngags yi @119a / ge bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: “Oṃ suṃbha ni suṃbha vajra ḍākinī huṃ huṃ phaṭ” is the fourteen-syllable mantra of the eastern face.

original: zla ba gsum gyis las rab 'byam gyi sgrub thabs su gsungs pa'i bgrang phreng gis 'bum phrag dgu bzlas par bya zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag dgu byas te zla ba dang po la mi'i rus pa'i bgrang phreng dang / gnyis pa la rnga mo'i rus pa'i bgrang phreng dang /
analyzed: zla ba gsum gyis las rab 'byam gyi sgrub thabs su gsungs pa'i bgrang phreng gis 'bum phrag dgu bzlas par bya zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag dgu byas te zla ba dang po la mi'i rus pa'i bgrang phreng dang / gnyis pa la rnga mo'i rus pa'i bgrang phreng dang /
translated: One should recite it nine hundred thousand times with a rosary as taught in the Sādhana for the Performance of All Activities, and perform a burnt offering of ninety thousand. In the first month, one should use a human bone rosary; in the second month, a camel bone rosary;

original: gsum pa la bong bu'i rus pa'i bgrang phreng gis bzlas pa bya zhing /
analyzed: gsum pa la bong bu'i rus pa'i bgrang phreng gis bzlas pa bya zhing /
translated: In the third, one should recite with a rosary of ass bone.

original: las rab 'byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: las rab 'byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should perform a burnt offering with the substances taught in the Sarvakarmāvaraṇaviśodhana.

original: de nas lug gi 'pho ba la tshang tshing du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas lug gi 'pho ba la tshang tshing du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Then, in the Aries ingress, one should construct a maṇḍala in a thicket.

original: l'a ma la mchod yon phul nas zla ba so so la 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pa bya zhing rdzogs pa so so la bcu cha'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: l'a ma la mchod yon phul nas zla ba so so la 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pa bya zhing rdzogs pa so so la bcu cha'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having offered a libation to Lāmā, one should recite three hundred thousand [mantras] in each month, and perform a burnt offering of one tenth at the end of each [month].

original: dang po'i zla ba la padma'i phreng bas so //
analyzed: dang po'i zla ba la padma'i phreng bas so //
translated: In the first month, [one should recite] with a garland of lotuses.

original: zla ba gnyis pa la tsandan dmar po'i phreng bas so //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa la tsandan dmar po'i phreng bas so //
translated: In the second month, [one should recite] with a garland of red sandalwood.

original: zla ba gsum pa la lung tang dmar po'i phreng bas so //
analyzed: zla ba gsum pa la lung tang dmar po'i phreng bas so //
translated: In the third month, [one should recite] with a garland of red lentils.

original: de ltar bzlas pa 'bum phrag dgu dang sbyin sreg khri phrag dgu byas te /
analyzed: de ltar bzlas pa 'bum phrag dgu dang sbyin sreg khri phrag dgu byas te /
translated: In this way, one should recite nine hundred thousand [mantras] and perform ninety thousand burnt offerings.

original: aom grihna grihna badzra l'a me hum h'um phat zhes pa lho'i zhal gyi sngags yi ge bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: aom grihna grihna badzra l'a me hum h'um phat zhes pa lho'i zhal gyi sngags yi ge bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Oṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa vajra-lāmā hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. This is the twelve-syllable mantra of the southern face.

original: de nas karkata'i 'pho ba la ri bor dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas karkata'i 'pho ba la ri bor dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Then, in the Cancer transit, one should construct the maṇḍala in a mountain cave.

original: du ma skyes ma la mchod yon phul nas zla ba so sos nub kyi zhal gyi sngags 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pa bya zhing bcu cha'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: du ma skyes ma la mchod yon phul nas zla ba so sos nub kyi zhal gyi sngags 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pa bya zhing bcu cha'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having offered water to the goddess Aśokakāntā, one should recite the mantra of the western face three hundred thousand times with each month, and perform a burnt offering of one-tenth.

original: zla ba dang po la bo de tse'i bgrang phreng dang / zla ba gnyis pa la ru r'aksha'i bgrang phreng dang / zla ba gsum pa la lung btang gi bgrang phreng gis bzlas pa bya zhing las rab 'byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang po la bo de tse'i bgrang phreng dang / zla ba gnyis pa la ru r'aksha'i bgrang phreng dang / zla ba gsum pa la lung btang gi bgrang phreng gis bzlas pa bya zhing las rab 'byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: In the first month, one should recite with a bodhi seed rosary; in the second month, with a rudrākṣa rosary; and in the third month, with a crystal rosary. One should perform the burnt offering with the substances taught in the Compendium of Action.

original: aom grihna pa ya grihna pa ya badzra khanda ro hi hum h'um phat ces pa nub kyi zhal gyi sngags yi ge bco brgyad pa ste 'bum phrag dgu bzlas pa bya zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag dgu bya'o //
analyzed: aom grihna pa ya grihna pa ya badzra khanda ro hi hum h'um phat ces pa nub kyi zhal gyi sngags yi ge bco brgyad pa ste 'bum phrag dgu bzlas pa bya zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag dgu bya'o //
translated: Oṃ, gṛhṇa gṛhṇa, vajra khaṇḍarohī, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. This is the eighteen-syllable mantra of the western face. One should recite it nine hundred thousand times and perform a burnt offering of ninety thousand.

original: de nas srang gi 'pho ba la ri sul du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas srang gi 'pho ba la ri sul du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Then, in the Libra transit, one should construct the maṇḍala in a mountain gorge.

original: gzugs can ma la mchod yon phul nas zla ba so so la byang gi zhal gyi sngags 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pa bya zhing las rab 'byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis khri phrag gsum sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma la mchod yon phul nas zla ba so so la byang gi zhal gyi sngags 'bum phrag gsum bzlas pa bya zhing las rab 'byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis khri phrag gsum sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having offered water for the feet to the goddess, one should recite the mantra of the northern face three hundred thousand times per month, and one should perform a homa of the substances taught in the Compendium of Action three hundred thousand times.

original: de nas dang po la shel gyi bgrang phreng dang / gnyis pa la mu tig gi bgrang phreng dang / gsum pa la dung gi @119b bgrang phreng gis so //
analyzed: de nas dang po la shel gyi bgrang phreng dang / gnyis pa la mu tig gi bgrang phreng dang / gsum pa la dung gi @119b bgrang phreng gis so //
translated: Then, in the first month, one should use a crystal rosary; in the second month, a pearl rosary; and in the third month, a conch rosary.

original: de ltar zla ba gsum gyis 'bum phrag dgu bzlas shing khri phrag dgu sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zla ba gsum gyis 'bum phrag dgu bzlas shing khri phrag dgu sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should recite nine hundred thousand times in three months and perform a homa of nine hundred thousand.

original: aom a'a na ya ho bha ga w'an badzra badzra r'u pi n'i ye hum h'um phat ces pa byang gi zhal gyi sngags yi ge bco brgyad pa bzlas shing sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a na ya ho bha ga w'an badzra badzra r'u pi n'i ye hum h'um phat ces pa byang gi zhal gyi sngags yi ge bco brgyad pa bzlas shing sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should recite and perform the homa with the mantra of the northern face, “Oṃ ānayaho bhagavān vajra vajrarūpiṇi hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ,” which has eighteen syllables.

original: de ltar lo gcig gis 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa drug bzlas pa bya zhing 'bum phrag gsum dang khri phrag drug sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar lo gcig gis 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa drug bzlas pa bya zhing 'bum phrag gsum dang khri phrag drug sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: In this way, one should recite thirty-six hundred thousand times in one year and perform a homa of three hundred thousand and sixty thousand.

original: de nas zhal dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas zhal dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the mouth becomes pure.

original: da ni kha dang rna ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i don du rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags bzlas pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni kha dang rna ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i don du rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags bzlas pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, in order to purify the mouth, ears, etc., the recitation of the eight-line mantra is to be performed.

original: 'dir lo gnyis pa la chu srin gyi 'pho ba la rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te khva gdong ma la mchod yon phul nas phyogs dang po la mi'i so'i bgrang phreng gis bzlas ba bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir lo gnyis pa la chu srin gyi 'pho ba la rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te khva gdong ma la mchod yon phul nas phyogs dang po la mi'i so'i bgrang phreng gis bzlas ba bya'o //
translated: Here, in the second year, in the Makara transit, having erected the mandala on the shore of the great ocean, having offered libation to Khakharā, one should recite in the first period with a human-bone rosary.

original: gnyis pa la rnga mo'i so'i bgrang phreng dang / gsum pa la bong bu'i so'i bgrang phreng gis so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la rnga mo'i so'i bgrang phreng dang / gsum pa la bong bu'i so'i bgrang phreng gis so //
translated: In the second period, with a camel-bone rosary, and in the third period, with an ass-bone rosary.

original: de ltar phyed bcas zla ba phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bzlas par bya zhing shar gyi zhal gyi las rab byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzhi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyed bcas zla ba phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bzlas par bya zhing shar gyi zhal gyi las rab byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzhi bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should recite four times one hundred thousand in a half-month, and perform four times fifty thousand burnt offerings with the substances taught in the eastern face section.

original: aom na mo bha ga wa te wi re sh'a ya badzra k'a k'a sye hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa dang po'i sngags yi ge bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: aom na mo bha ga wa te wi re sh'a ya badzra k'a k'a sye hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa dang po'i sngags yi ge bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: The mantra of the first line is: Om, homage to the Blessed One, Virupaksa, Vajra Crow, hum hum phat! It has nineteen syllables.

original: de nas bum pa'i phyed la tshang tshing du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas bum pa'i phyed la tshang tshing du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Then, in the forest on the edge of the town, one should erect the mandala.

original: 'ug gdong ma la mchod yon phul nas l'a ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis phyogs gsum la phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi'i sngags bzlas shing bcu cha'i sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: 'ug gdong ma la mchod yon phul nas l'a ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis phyogs gsum la phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi'i sngags bzlas shing bcu cha'i sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Having offered a libation to Uluka, one should recite the mantra of the second line, which was told to Rama, with a rosary, for four hundred thousand and five hundred thousand times in three directions, and perform a burnt offering of one-tenth of that.

original: aom ma h'a ka w'a gmi sam ni bh'a ya badzrod lu k'a sye h'um phat ces pa rkang pa gnyis pa'i sngags yi ge bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: aom ma h'a ka w'a gmi sam ni bh'a ya badzrod lu k'a sye h'um phat ces pa rkang pa gnyis pa'i sngags yi ge bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: The mantra of the second line is: Om, to the great speech, the fearful, Vajra Owl, hum phat! It has eighteen syllables.

original: de nas lug gi 'pho ba la ri bor dkyil 'khor bzhengs te khyi gdong ma la mchod yon phul nas zla ba phyed dang bcas par du ma skyes ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhis sngags bzlas shing bcu chas sbyin sreg
analyzed: de nas lug gi 'pho ba la ri bor dkyil 'khor bzhengs te khyi gdong ma la mchod yon phul nas zla ba phyed dang bcas par du ma skyes ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhis sngags bzlas shing bcu chas sbyin sreg
translated: One should perform the burnt offerings with a tenth part.

original: bya ste / aom dza t'a ma ku to tka t'a ya badzra shv'a n'a sye hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa gsum pa'i sngags yi ge bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bya ste / aom dza t'a ma ku to tka t'a ya badzra shv'a n'a sye hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa gsum pa'i sngags yi ge bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: The mantra of the third line, “Oṃ, to the one with a topknot and a crown protrusion, the vajra-born, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ,” is seventeen syllables.

original: de nas khyu mchog gi phyed kyi nyin zhag la ri sul du dkyil 'khor @120a * //
analyzed: de nas khyu mchog gi phyed kyi nyin zhag la ri sul du dkyil 'khor @120a * //
translated: Then, in the first half of the bull lunar mansion, having erected the mandala in a mountain cave,

original: bzhengs te / phag gdong ma la mchod yon phul nas zla ba phyed dang gnyis su bcas par gzugs can ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzlas pa bya zhing phyed dang bcas pa'i khri phrag bzhis sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: bzhengs te / phag gdong ma la mchod yon phul nas zla ba phyed dang gnyis su bcas par gzugs can ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzlas pa bya zhing phyed dang bcas pa'i khri phrag bzhis sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: having offered water for the feet to the face of a pig, one should recite the mantra four times ten-thousands, together with one and a half months, with a rosary of rudrākṣa beads described by Rūpiṇī. One should perform the burnt offerings with fourteen-thousands.

original: aom damsht'a ka r'a lo gra bh'i sha na mu kh'a ya badzra shu k'a r'a sye hum h'um phat ces pa rkang ba bzhi pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o //🔽de nas karka ta 'char ba na padma'i mtshor ri sul ltar dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /🔽gshin rje brtan ma la mchod yon phul nas /🔽gzugs can ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gi cho gas phyed dang bcas pa'i zla bar phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhis bzlas pa bya zhing bcu chas sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: aom damsht'a ka r'a lo gra bh'i sha na mu kh'a ya badzra shu k'a r'a sye hum h'um phat ces pa rkang ba bzhi pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o // de nas karka ta 'char ba na padma'i mtshor ri sul ltar dkyil 'khor bzhengs te / gshin rje brtan ma la mchod yon phul nas / gzugs can ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gi cho gas phyed dang bcas pa'i zla bar phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhis bzlas pa bya zhing bcu chas sbyin sreg bya'o //

original: gshin rje pho nya mo la mchod yon phul nas dum skyes ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng dang cho gas phyogs gsum gyi phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bcu bzhis bzlas pa bya zhing bcu chas sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: gshin rje pho nya mo la mchod yon phul nas dum skyes ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng dang cho gas phyogs gsum gyi phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bcu bzhis bzlas pa bya zhing bcu chas sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Having offered water for the feet to the messenger of Yama, one should recite the rosary and the rite told to Dombī, and one should recite the mantra 1,440,000 times in three directions, and one should perform the burnt offering with one-tenth of that.🔽The mantra of six lines, with twenty-five syllables, is:

original: aom bar shu p'a sho dya ta sh'u la /
analyzed: aom bar shu p'a sho dya ta sh'u la /
translated: Oṃ, Varuṇa, Pāśodaya, Śūla,

original: kha tv'am ga dha ri ne badzra ya ma d'u t'i h'um h'um phat ces pa'i rkang pa drug pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga dha ri ne badzra ya ma d'u t'i h'um h'um phat ces pa'i rkang pa drug pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
translated: Khaṭvāṅga, Dharini, Vajrayoginī, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de nas sra nga gi 'pho ba la skyed mos tshal du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas sra nga gi 'pho ba la skyed mos tshal du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Then, in the matter of the transference of the spirit, one should erect the maṇḍala in a pleasure grove.

original: gshin rje mche ba ma la mchod yon phul nas l'a ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng dang cho gas zla ba phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bzlas pa bya zhing phyed dang bcas pa'i khri phrag bzhi spyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: gshin rje mche ba ma la mchod yon phul nas l'a ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng dang cho gas zla ba phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bzlas pa bya zhing phyed dang bcas pa'i khri phrag bzhi spyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Having offered water for the feet to Yamadāntī, one should recite the rosary and the rite told to Lāmā, and one should recite the mantra 400,000 times in three directions, and one should perform the burnt offering 40,000 times in three directions.

original: aom by'a ghra dzi n'am ba ra dha r'a ya badzra ya ma dam shti ni hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bdun pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu pa'o //🔽de nas sdig pa'i phyed kyi nyin zhag la rgya mtsho'i 'gram mam rgya mtsho med na rdzing bu'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: aom by'a ghra dzi n'am ba ra dha r'a ya badzra ya ma dam shti ni hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bdun pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu pa'o // de nas sdig pa'i phyed kyi nyin zhag la rgya mtsho'i 'gram mam rgya mtsho med na rdzing bu'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: The twenty-syllable mantra of the seven-line praise is: Oṃ vyāghrī-jñānāṃ varada-rādhaya vajra-yamāntakini hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: gshin rje 'joms ma la mchod yon phul nas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng dang cho gas phyogs gsum la phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi sngags bzlas shing rdzogs pa re re la ji srid phyed dang bcas pa'i khri phrag bzhi'i bar du
analyzed: gshin rje 'joms ma la mchod yon phul nas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng dang cho gas phyogs gsum la phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi sngags bzlas shing rdzogs pa re re la ji srid phyed dang bcas pa'i khri phrag bzhi'i bar du
translated: Then, on the day of the full moon, one should erect the maṇḍala on the shore of the ocean, or if there is no ocean, on the shore of a lake, and offer libation to Yamāntakṛt. Reciting the rosary described by Vajraḍāka, one should recite the mantra four hundred thousand times in three directions, with half [each time].

original: sbyin sreg @120b bya ste de ltar cho ga thams cad la'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg @120b bya ste de ltar cho ga thams cad la'o //
translated: In each completion, one should perform homa until four hundred thousand [times]. Thus, in all rituals.

original: aom ma h'a dhu mr'a ndha k'a ra wa bush'a ya badzra la ma ma th'a ni hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: aom ma h'a dhu mr'a ndha k'a ra wa bush'a ya badzra la ma ma th'a ni hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
translated: Oṃ mahādhumrāndhakāravaśayavajra-lamāmatha ni hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. This is the twenty-two syllable mantra of the eight-line verse.

original: de ltar lo gcig gis 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa drug bzlas pa bya zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag gsum cu rtsa drug bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar lo gcig gis 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa drug bzlas pa bya zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag gsum cu rtsa drug bya ste /
translated: Thus, in one year, one should recite thirty-six hundred thousand [times] and perform thirty-six thousand fire sacrifices.

original: de nas kha dang rna ba dang bshang lam dang sna dang mig dag par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de nas kha dang rna ba dang bshang lam dang sna dang mig dag par 'gyur ro /
translated: Then one's mouth, ears, anus, nose, and eyes will be purified.

original: // / da ni yan lag so so'i sngags rkang ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'i bzlas pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni yan lag so so'i sngags rkang ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'i bzlas pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the recitation of the twenty-four-line mantra of each limb should be stated.

original: 'dir rgya mtsho'i 'gram mam ma rnyed na ba tsha can gyi chu 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: 'dir rgya mtsho'i 'gram mam ma rnyed na ba tsha can gyi chu 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Here, on the shore of the ocean, or if not found, on the shore of a hot spring, one should construct the maṇḍala.

original: mgo'i zla ba'i gnam stong la rab gtum ma la mchod yon phul nas tshes lnga la khri phrag lnga bzlas par bya zhing stong phrag lnga sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: mgo'i zla ba'i gnam stong la rab gtum ma la mchod yon phul nas tshes lnga la khri phrag lnga bzlas par bya zhing stong phrag lnga sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: On the full moon of the head [month], having offered libation to Prachaṇḍā, on the fifth lunar day, one should recite five hundred thousand [times] and perform five thousand fire sacrifices.

original: de ltar nyin zhag bco lngas sngags 'bum phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzlas par bya zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag bco lngas sngags 'bum phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzlas par bya zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bya ste /
translated: Thus, in fifteen days, one should recite the mantra with half a hundred thousand [mantras] and perform the homa with half a hundred thousand [oblations].

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis so sor sngags khri phrag lnga bzlas pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis so sor sngags khri phrag lnga bzlas pa ni /
translated: [One should recite] the mantra five times ten thousand [times] with the rosary described in the Vajradaka,

original: aom kar ka ra badzra pra tsande badzra khanda ka p'a li hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa dang po'i sngags yi ge nyi shu pa'o //
analyzed: aom kar ka ra badzra pra tsande badzra khanda ka p'a li hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa dang po'i sngags yi ge nyi shu pa'o //
translated: [Reciting] the mantra of the first line, Om kara kara vajra pracana deva vajra khandaka pali hum hum phat, which has twenty syllables.

original: de nas mgo'i zla ba'i nya la tshang tshing ngam skyed mos tshal du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas mgo'i zla ba'i nya la tshang tshing ngam skyed mos tshal du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Then, on the full moon of the head [month], one should construct the mandala in a thicket or a pleasure grove,

original: gtum mig ma la mchod yon phul nas l'a ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis ngar bzhin phyogs gcig gis 'bum phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzlas shing sbyin sreg hri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bya ste /
analyzed: gtum mig ma la mchod yon phul nas l'a ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis ngar bzhin phyogs gcig gis 'bum phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzlas shing sbyin sreg hri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bya ste /
translated: offer a libation to Caṇḍākṣī, and recite the mantra with half a hundred thousand [recitations] in one direction with the rosary described in the Lāmā, and perform the homa with half a hundred thousand [oblations].

original: aom ku ru ku ru badzra tsand'a ksh'i badzra ma h'a kam kas la hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa gnyis pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu ba'o //
analyzed: aom ku ru ku ru badzra tsand'a ksh'i badzra ma h'a kam kas la hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa gnyis pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu ba'o //
translated: Oṃ kuru kuru vajra candrakhaṭvāṅga vajra mahākaṅkāla hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ is the mantra of the second line, with twenty syllables.

original: de nas rgyal gyi zla ba'i gnam stong la ri bor dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal gyi zla ba'i gnam stong la ri bor dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Then, on the thirtieth day of the month of Vaiśākha, one should erect the maṇḍala in a mountain cave.

original: 'od ldan ma la mchod yon phul nas dum skyes ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis tshes bco lnga rnams kyis phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzlas shing phyed dang bcas pa'i khri phrag sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: 'od ldan ma la mchod yon phul nas dum skyes ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis tshes bco lnga rnams kyis phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzlas shing phyed dang bcas pa'i khri phrag sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having offered water for the feet to Marīcī, one should recite the rosary told to Caṇḍī, with the fifteen lunar days, for one hundred thousand times with the half, and perform the homa for ten thousand times with the half.

original: aom bandha bandha badzra pra bh'a wa ti badzra kam ka la hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa gsum pa'i sngags yi ge bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: aom bandha bandha badzra pra bh'a wa ti badzra kam ka la hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa gsum pa'i sngags yi ge bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: Oṃ bandha bandha vajra prabhāvatī vajra kaṅkāla hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ is the mantra of the third line, with nineteen syllables.

original: de nas rgyal gyi zla ba'i nya la ri sul lam padma'i mtsho 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal gyi zla ba'i nya la ri sul lam padma'i mtsho 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Then, on the full moon day of the month of Jyeṣṭha, one should erect the maṇḍala in a mountain gorge or on the bank of a lotus lake.

original: sna chen ma la mchod yon phul nas gzugs can ma la brjod pa'i @121a * //
analyzed: sna chen ma la mchod yon phul nas gzugs can ma la brjod pa'i @121a * //
translated: Having offered water for the feet to Mahānāsā, one should recite the rosary told to Rūpiṇī, with the fifteen lunar days, for one hundred thousand times with the half, and perform the homa for ten thousand times with the half.

original: bgrang phreng gis nyin zhag bco lnga rnams kyis 'bum phrag phyed dang gnyis bzlas shing khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bgrang phreng gis nyin zhag bco lnga rnams kyis 'bum phrag phyed dang gnyis bzlas shing khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa'o //
translated: With the rosary, one recites one hundred and fifty thousand [mantras] in fifteen days.

original: aom tr'a sa ya tr'a sa ya badzra ma h'a n'a se badzra bi ka ta dam sht'i ne hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bzhi pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: aom tr'a sa ya tr'a sa ya badzra ma h'a n'a se badzra bi ka ta dam sht'i ne hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bzhi pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o //
translated: Oṃ trāsaya trāsaya vajra mahānasya vajra vikatadaṃṣṭrīṇa huṃ huṃ phaṭ. This is the mantra of four lines, with twenty-three syllables.

original: de nas mchu'i zla ba'i gnam stong la ri sul lam padma'i mtsho 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas mchu'i zla ba'i gnam stong la ri sul lam padma'i mtsho 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Then, on the full moon of the month of Caitra, one should construct the maṇḍala in a mountain cave or on the bank of a lotus lake.

original: dpa' bo'i blo can ma la mchod yon phul nas gzugs can ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis phyogs gcig la phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzlas shing khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa'i sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: dpa' bo'i blo can ma la mchod yon phul nas gzugs can ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis phyogs gcig la phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzlas shing khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa'i sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Having offered a libation to the heroines, one should recite one hundred and fifty thousand [mantras] in one direction with the rosary described for Rūpiṇī, and perform one hundred and fifty thousand fire offerings.

original: aom ksho bha ya ksho bha ya badzra b'i ra ma ti badzra su bee ri hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa lnga pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o //🔽de nas mchu'i zla ba'i nya la ri bor dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /🔽mi'u thung ma la mchod yon phul nas dum skyes ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis nyin zhag lnga tshan gsum la 'bum phrag phyed dang gnyis pa bzla zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bya'o //
analyzed: aom ksho bha ya ksho bha ya badzra b'i ra ma ti badzra su bee ri hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa lnga pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o // de nas mchu'i zla ba'i nya la ri bor dkyil 'khor bzhengs te / mi'u thung ma la mchod yon phul nas dum skyes ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis nyin zhag lnga tshan gsum la 'bum phrag phyed dang gnyis pa bzla zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bya'o //
translated: The mantra of five lines, with twenty-two syllables, is: Om kshobhaya kshobhaya, vajra-virya mati, vajra-suvairi hûm hûm phaṭ.🔽Then, on the full moon of the month of Mârgasîrsha, one should erect the mandala of the mountain.🔽Having offered a libation to the dwarf woman, one should recite the mantra of the rosary told to Bhrkuṭī, for three sets of five days, one hundred and fifty thousand times, and perform a homa of ten thousand.

original: de nas dpo'i zla ba'i gnam stong la tshang tshing ngam skyed mos tshal du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te lang ka'i dbang phyug ma la mchod yon phul nas nyin zhag lnga tshan gsum la l'a ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis 'bum phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzla zhing
analyzed: de nas dpo'i zla ba'i gnam stong la tshang tshing ngam skyed mos tshal du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te lang ka'i dbang phyug ma la mchod yon phul nas nyin zhag lnga tshan gsum la l'a ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis 'bum phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzla zhing
translated: Then, on the full moon of the winter, having erected the maṇḍala in a forest or a pleasure grove, having offered a libation to Laṅkeśvarī, one should recite the mantra one hundred and fifty thousand times with a rosary of rudraksha beads over three sets of five days and nights.

original: sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bya'o //
translated: One should perform the homa one hundred and fifty thousand times.

original: aom hra: hra: badzra lam ke shva r'i badzra pra bh'a hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bdun pa'i sngags yi ge bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: aom hra: hra: badzra lam ke shva r'i badzra pra bh'a hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bdun pa'i sngags yi ge bcu drug pa'o //
translated: “Oṃ hṛ hṛ vajra-laṃkeśvari vajra-prabhā hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ” is the mantra of the seven-line praise, with sixteen syllables.

original: de nas dbo'i zla ba'i nya la rgya mtsho'i 'gram mam ba tsha can gyi chu 'gram mam khron pa'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas dbo'i zla ba'i nya la rgya mtsho'i 'gram mam ba tsha can gyi chu 'gram mam khron pa'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /
translated: Then, on the full moon of the winter, having erected the maṇḍala on the bank of the ocean, on the bank of a salty river, or on the bank of a spring,

original: shing grib ma la mchod yon phul nas mkha' 'gro ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis nyin zhag lnga tshan gsum pa la 'bum phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzla zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bya'o //
analyzed: shing grib ma la mchod yon phul nas mkha' 'gro ma la brjod pa'i bgrang phreng gis nyin zhag lnga tshan gsum pa la 'bum phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzla zhing sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bya'o //
translated: Having offered water for the feet to the shadow of the tree, one should recite the mantra of the dakini, which is the rosary mentioned, for three periods of five days each, together with a hundred thousand, and perform a homa of ten thousand, together with half.

original: aom phem phem badzra dru matstsh'a ye badzra de ha hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags yi ge bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: aom phem phem badzra dru matstsh'a ye badzra de ha hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags yi ge bcu drug pa'o //
translated: Oṃ pheṃ pheṃ vajra-drum-cakra-vajra-deha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. This is the mantra of eight lines, with sixteen syllables.🔽 In this way, on the full moon of the dark half, having offered water for the feet to Vasudhara, according to the rite mentioned for Caṇḍikā, one should recite the mantra and perform the homa.🔽 Oṃ daṃ daṃ vajra-rāva-ti vajra-mukuṭika hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. This is the mantra of nine lines, with eighteen syllables.

original: aom da ha da ha badzra r'a ba ti badzr'am ku ri ka hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa dgu pa'i sngags yi ge bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: aom da ha da ha badzra r'a ba ti badzr'am ku ri ka hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa dgu pa'i sngags yi ge bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: Oṃ vaṃ vaṃ vajra-pṛ

original: de nas nag pa'i zla ba'i nya la gtum mig ma la brjod pa'i cho gas 'jigs byed chen mo la mchod yon phul nas sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nag pa'i zla ba'i nya la gtum mig ma la brjod pa'i cho gas 'jigs byed chen mo la mchod yon phul nas sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, on the full moon of the dark half of the month, one should offer a libation to Mahābhairavā according to the rite described for Caṇḍākṣī, recite the mantra, and perform the burnt offering.

original: aom pa tsa pa tsa badzra ma h'a bhee ra pe badzra dz'a ti la hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bcu pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu pa'o //
analyzed: aom pa tsa pa tsa badzra ma h'a bhee ra pe badzra dz'a ti la hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bcu pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu pa'o //
translated: Oṃ, paca paca, O Vajra Great Hero, O Vajra Born, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. This is the twenty-syllable mantra of the ten-line verse.

original: de nas sa ga'i zla ba'i gnam stong la 'od ldan ma la brjod pa'i cho gas rlung shugs ma la mchod yon phul nas sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sa ga'i zla ba'i gnam stong la 'od ldan ma la brjod pa'i cho gas rlung shugs ma la mchod yon phul nas sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, on the full moon of the bright half of the month, one should offer a libation to Ghoradīptā according to the rite described for Prabhāvatī, recite the mantra, and perform the burnt offering.

original: aom bhaksha bhaksha badzra b'a yu be ge badzra ma h'a b'i ra hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bcu gcig pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu pa'o //
analyzed: aom bhaksha bhaksha badzra b'a yu be ge badzra ma h'a b'i ra hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bcu gcig pa'i sngags yi ge nyi shu pa'o //
translated: Oṃ, bhakṣa bhakṣa, O Vajra Great Hero, O Vajra Wind-swift, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. This is the twenty-syllable mantra of the eleven-line verse.

original: de nas sa ga'i zla ba'i nya la sna chen ma la brjod pa'i cho gas chang 'thung ma la mchod yon phul nas sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sa ga'i zla ba'i nya la sna chen ma la brjod pa'i cho gas chang 'thung ma la mchod yon phul nas sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, on the full moon of the bright half of the month, one should offer a libation to Mahābalā according to the rite described for Mahānāsā, recite the mantra, and perform the burnt offering.🔽Oṃ, māraya māraya, O Vajra Great Hero, O Vajra Great Strength, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. This is the twenty-syllable mantra of the twelve-line verse.

original: aom ba sa ru dhi r'antra m'a l'a ba lam bi ne grihna grihna badzra su ra bhakshi badzra hum ka ra hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bcu gnyis pa'i sngags yi ge sum cu rtsa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: aom ba sa ru dhi r'antra m'a l'a ba lam bi ne grihna grihna badzra su ra bhakshi badzra hum ka ra hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa bcu gnyis pa'i sngags yi ge sum cu rtsa gcig pa'o //
translated: Oṃ vasaru dhīra ntra mālava lambavine gṛhṇa gṛhṇa vajra surā bakṣi vajra hūṃkāra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ. This is the mantra of twelve lines with thirty-one syllables.

original: de nas snron gyi zla ba'i gnam stong la dpa' bo'i blo can ma la brjod pa'i cho gas lha mo sngo bsangs ma la mchod yon phul nas sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas snron gyi zla ba'i gnam stong la dpa' bo'i blo can ma la brjod pa'i cho gas lha mo sngo bsangs ma la mchod yon phul nas sngags bzla zhing sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, on the full moon of Āṣāḍha, having offered a libation to the goddess Śyāmādevī according to the rite described in the Hero's Mind, one should recite the mantra and perform the homa.
